Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel - service is so so”
Reviews.Author: dkuchs
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel. Overall, this is a fine place. The jazz club is excellent and we were able to go to see Ramsey Lewis this past weekend. The show was fantastic and everyone who works at the club are excellent. This time I was smart and booked a king room. During the last visit, I asked for 2 beds and unfortunately, that meant 2 twin beds which were too small and uncomfortable. If you are travelling with 2 and don't want to share a bed, this hotel is not for you. We ate dinner one night with our extended family of 9 in the restaurant and the food was good. The service wasn't up to par and dirty dishes were left on our table after new food had been brought out. This caused a very crowded table. Also, our server didn't stop back to see if we needed/wanted anything else until we were almost done eating. That being said, the food was good. Another evening we stopped at the bar to have a drink and there was no one in it to wait on us. When she finally returned after 5 mins or so, she didn't even acknowledge us and started folding silverware in napkins rather than seeing if anyone wanted to order. Eventually we got her attention and drinks which were fine. Now as to delivering hilton honors benefits, they do offer the basic continental breakfast included in room rates. If you want the hot items, $6.00 extra charge. I booked a king suite and that is exactly what I was given. No upgrade although the clerk said a river view is an upgrade. I asked for a larger corner room or one of the loft suites, but was told no. Same thing during my last visit 4 months ago. The housekeeping staff are excellent and also so happy to give you extra water or peanuts and the rooms are definitely well cleaned. The shuttle is nice and has friendly drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Lynn86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during July, 2011. I had stayed at other hotels in Boston downtown but the first time at this hotel. While our stay was comfortable and affordable (good location), I would not stay here again due to the fact the pool you use is at the YMCA (closed on Sundays). This was disappointing. We were issued breakfast for two coupons which was a nice touch (breakfast buffet will run you approximately $15 each). I would look to other hotels to stay downtown Boston. We took the communitor train to Salem for $10 each. I would actually stay outside Boston and just take the train into the city to spend the day. Highly recommend Fajita & Ritas! :))))

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: S R
Reviews.Content: Liked the location on the Charles River. Perfect for those of us who like an early morning run in a safe, accessible location-just head out the door and you're there. Used the fitness center once. Treadmills were top notch. Was suprised that my business companion and I had only the choice of twin beds; didn't know hotels even offered twins! It was OK because we had the adjoining suite area to spread out. Think it is long overdue to offer free wireless. Really cheap of a Hilton to not have this as a given! Breakfast buffet was expensive at $19. Concierge was very helpful. Liked having taxis waiting for us in the morning. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Your reservation is never secured, never”
Reviews.Author: jazocar
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice rooms. I recently made a reservation for a suite, two rooms for 3 persons. I was planning to arrive late about 11:00 pm. At 10.30 pm I got a call from the Hotel front desk telling me that they will cancel, my already paid reservation, and give me a smaller room with only one bed. No explanation. Went to the hotel anyway and even the supervisor Ms Villafana was no help. No nice treatment for the guests. Be careful if you get a good price and make plans to arribve late. Better drop my the hotel early and check in, or you may left with no room. Or look for another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Quality Team”
Reviews.Author: brucect
Reviews.Content: Recent stay at the Doubletree was very good. I arrived at 830pm and was checked in quickly; bellman took all our luggage and we parked two cars. We were in our rooms in ten minutes. The room was totally ready and nothing was amiss. We went to dinner at the hotel lounge and ordered immediately. After 35 minutes dinner had not arrived.The waiter was totally apologetic and explained the kitchen was swamped due to a jazz performance in the main room. Oh yeah this hotel has a reknown jass lunge so check it out. In any event the meals came and were very good. When the check was requested the witer siad dinner was on the house as we had to wait so long. How often does this happen? The hotel took it upon themselves to set things right. Totally impressed. Only thing to note is the hotel charges $35 dollars to park overnight in their garage. With two cars I thought this was an unneeded revenue source.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Great Jazz!!”
Reviews.Author: Dadeeyo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a spur of the moment trip to Boston and we found that this Double Tree was more than suiting for our getaway. Even though it is outside the center of Boston's downtown it was a short drive to downtown or the action near Harvard's Campus with shopping and Cafes alike. This was the best of both worlds. The Scullers Jazz Club was excellent we saw Rufus Reid and friends. Great TIME!!

Reviews.Title: “Just we needed”
Reviews.Author: Joshua J
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was the second stop for us in our vacation heading east and then south. We loved the views and the accomodations. The staff was great to my wife and I and to the other guest who was in front of us and completely out of line!( The staff handled them politely a proffessionally) The guest clearly "Nuts". Our room was clean and of couse we would saty again as we were treated as expected in a Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: msegalla
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Shuttle to Harvard and Boston Downtown. 10 minute walk from Harvard Business School. Great pool. We stay here every year. The hotel has a great breakfast service. My children adore the fresh chocolate cookies. Rooms are comfortable. Parking in convienent but expensive. NIce to have a separate room for the children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great location, terrible experience.”
Reviews.Author: Erin R
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was gorgeous, easy to find - right before Storrow Drive with amazing views of the Charles. However, upon arriving at 1PM for a wedding, we were well prepared to wait until 3PM (check-in) for our room. We sat in Fusion lounge - overpriced and typical, poor hotel food, until our room was supposed to be ready. We went down to the lobby at 3PM to find out that our room wasn't ready - and wouldn't be for another 30 minutes (or so we were told). It wasn't ready until 430PM! With a wedding in a couple hours, it was not a pleasant experience. The rooms were spacious, with a separate bedroom adjacent to the living room with "pull-out" sofa. The sofa did not pull out - it was broken and we tried for about 30 minutes until giving up and squeezing 2 people on the couch overnight. The TV in the main bedroom did not work. When checking out, we had 3 rooms all together. My parents room service was on our bill and our room service was on my sister's bill. Made for more of a headache during check out after minimal sleep on the couch. Although I highly recommend the property itself - I hope everyone else has less of a hassle than we did. I normally stay at Sheraton's and this was actually my first time at a Hilton, and was rather disappointed by our quality of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable. Spacious. Clean. Relatively convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Miley2007
Reviews.Content: Although we had to wait in line at check in, everything else was just perfect. The staff was sincerely polite and helpful, from the front desk to the housekeeping, always acknowledging the guest. Rooms were spacious, attractive, well set up. The bathrooms were clean. The bedding was comfortable, crisp and clean. The atrium and interior glass elevator is nothing short of spectacular. The atrium setup of this hotel makes it a bit noisy, but it didn't bother us at all. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to Harvard Square. Some rooms have a view of the Charles River, others a view of Boston. Study a map really well before you drive to this location, as there are many one-way streets and finding the entrance to this hotel was a big challenge after dark. Parking on site seemed secure, but it was pricey (as is parking in all of Boston).

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree in Cambridge: great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsCasualTravelor
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying overnight at the Doubletree Hilton hotel in Cambridge (Allston, to be exact), over the bridge from Harvard. Big VooDoo Daddy was playing at their jazz club - too bad I didn't get tickets for it, it was wonderful according to some of the sold out crowds. The room was a nice suite. Breakfast was great, but at $19 was a bit expensive. And I was told by someone who stays there a lot that you need to tip the waitstaff quite heavily, otherwise they don't pay attention to you :-( The parking garage is tricky to get in and out of with the heavy Boston traffic, but once at the hotel they have a shuttle that goes to a lot of the popular Boston destinations (Harvard Square, Fanuel Hall / Quincy Market, etc). All in all, I'd stay there again if I was going to be in that part of Boston. (If you stay there, go to the lounge and get an order of their sweet potatoe tater tots - yum!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Dinner, Show and Stay Package--a great experience”
Reviews.Author: IrishDawn
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a one-night stay at this hotel as park of a Dinner/Show/Stay package. The Cambridge Doubletree gets some of the best Jazz acts in the country to play at its bar, Scullers (aptly named for its position on the Charles River, known for the many crew teams that practice there). The package we booked included parking, dinner, tickets to a great show, and a room with a river view on the 15th floor. Everything ran like clock-work, from checking in, to the timing of our dinner reservation, to the short elevator ride after the show to our room. This hotel has its act together. The room was clean, quiet and modern. Since this is a suite hotel, there's plenty of room to spread out. Service was impeccable from the front desk to the restaurant to the jazz bar. And those cookies you get a check-in...yum!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuneOlympia
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great and the views are wonderful. The room was very comfortable and for an atrium hotel, the noise level was Not bad at all - even on New Year's Eve when we decided to get out of the cold of the First Night events & watch the midnight fireworks from our room & on TV. The hotel staff at the front desk were great with the exception of Saturday & Sunday . . . then the service was ridiculously absent and they were unavailable to answer their phones. The shuttle service to downtown Boston attractions/hot spots was a real bonus and the breakfast service and selections were excellent. We will definitely consider this location on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for stay!”
Reviews.Author: haynestravel
Reviews.Content: Great value for this hotel! they offered a free shuttle service to a few different popular Boston attractions. Restaurants within hotel were good but pricey! Room was a suite so that was great. Warm cookies at checkin! Internet was extra and fridge in room was noisy but I did notify them. Definitely book a package with parking and breakfast since they are both pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Location hmmmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: jbgaines04
Reviews.Content: This was business related trip so I had stay within a given budget. While this is not a bad hotel, it was obvious to me that it needs updating. When I arrived to my room I was met with a smell that was just unbearable. I call the front desk and did someone to up with a room purifier, which did correct the issue, but I had to leave for several hours. Of a different note, when you arrive they provide you with those hot cookies that just melt in your mouth, the person at the front desk was nice enough to offer me two them â˜º I was a little disappointed in the location, your located in corner of a major intersection with traffic coming from all directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Twinbro1
Reviews.Content: Great location and we had a great view of the Charles River. Rooms were clean and great location to downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel...Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ICE-MOH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family in July 2010. The hotel was 5 minutes from downtown Boston, with quick access to high ways. We stayed at the bi level suite which was ok but not worth $420 a night ! Parking is not free at this hotel, and the parking card used to open the gate is not reliable. Food was not good and the hotel is very busy and noisy. Staff was helpful and the concierge was great. The air condition in our room was very bad and we complained about it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas P
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of my favorite places to stay. This is a very clean hotel, it's well-run, nicely appointed, and in a great location. Additionally, their Sculler's Jazz Club is a wonderful place to catch a show and their restaurant is fantastic. This is a great hotel for any type of trip and they've got wonderful business accomodations, too. The beds and pillows are very comfortable and make for a wonderfully restful night. Classy, fun place in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “5 day stay over Thanksgiving break”
Reviews.Author: b1g_sister
Reviews.Content: $99/night online booking. 1.5 miles from Harvard - a nice walk. same distance from MIT. woke up to the Charles River and rowers. free shuttles to boston sites. turned off heat as we were on 9th floor, so very comfy. one of the best hotels stays i've had (across all kinds from high to low-end). am already at&t subscriber, so used wifi for no fee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good view”
Reviews.Author: JackFlynn
Reviews.Content: I might complain about the $35 parking, but that's the going rate in Boston these days. The hotel was very nice. The rooms have a small living room and fair sized bedroom. We also had a great view of the Charles River. We pricelined it, and did fairly well considering weekday room rates in Boston lately. It's a bit off the beaten path (about 4 miles from the city center). Overall, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, odd location”
Reviews.Author: athtrasna
Reviews.Content: Got the hotel on Priceline, at a very reasonable rate (room only) for high season in Boston. Got a taxi direct from the airport to the hotel, the location is bizarre. On a busy traffic intersection. Probably convenient if you are driving. We used their free shuttle bus to Harvard Square one of the days there, that was helpful. Check in was swift, efficient yet friendly. The warm cookies were yummy! Our suite was on the 8th floor, close to the elevator. Was a little worried about noise disturbing our sleep but the bedroom was at the back so we needn't have worried. The living room was spacious and comfortable, the Wolfgang & Puck coffee was great. The bedroom had plenty of floor space for our big cases, and a large comfy bed. The room overlooked the river, we had a great view from our large window. Traffic noise could be heard but wasn't an issue. En suite bathroom was large, with lots of counter space. No magnifying mirror (I'm short sighted so this is something I always watch out for). The shower pressure was poor, and temperature unreliable. The hotel was fine for what we needed in this trip, nothing to complain about, only the coffee and cookies to rave about!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sabinerietveld
Reviews.Content: Not to expensive, and in the middle of the theatre district in Boston. Great beds. For some reason no free wifi though, which is pretty weird. It's not 2001 anymore!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: I was there again last week and introduced it to yet another colleague who will become a constant visitor. I had a wonderful room; bi-level with a lovely river view. Continental breakfast was substantial and while the congestion from the Mass Pike can be intense, this is so convenient. Plenty of parking at $30 night with come and go privileges. Did not eat there but we split a bottle of wine and had a good talk. My friend's room looked out over the highway or ramp and was not as nice as mine, but still made her very happy. See pictures of my room. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Style and Quality. Superb”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Bromley
Reviews.Content: Set just over the Charles River from Cambridge this is a stylish hotel offering excellent accommodation and service. We needed two separate sleeping rooms and rather than take on two rooms the Doubletreeâ€™s suites style makes this an ideal compromise. A spacious and well-appointed lobby had comfortable seating, access to an internet room, a small shop and an efficiently run reception. Check in was quick and I love the welcoming warm chocolate cookie on arrival. We were on the 14th floor (of 15) and a glass sided lift took us up through the open atrium. Our room comprised a large living room with an enormous King sofa bed (the maid was there within 5 minutes to make it up), a well fitted bath/shower room, a fridge, microwave and coffee machine and finally an uber-comfortable king sized bedroom overlooking the Charles River. Quite apart from the comfortable accommodation you will enjoy the excellent breakfast overlooking the river. Buffet and service combine with a chef to prepare pancakes, omelettes and the like to order. In the atrium there is a very relaxing bar with superb food for those who prefer the less formal style. Iâ€™d recommend this chain â€“ and this hotel in particular â€“ as it offers something for everyone, affordability and, most important, quality by the bucket load.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of money for average room”
Reviews.Author: cam970
Reviews.Content: Booked this room for two week nights while in Boston on business. The room was not nearly as nice as rooms / hotels I've stayed in for half the price. The carpet had some nasty stain on it which had hardened. There was a desk chair in the room if you want to call it that. It was made of fabric, which also was stained and was what I'd consider the kind of chair I'd put in one of my children's room. The mattresses on the bed I slept in felt cheap and had poor support. In what are considered middle of the road rooms, I've typically had the use of a microwave and an in room safe, as well as a free breakfast, but not at this hotel. If this is how it is to stay at a 5 star hotel, thanks anyway, I'll pass.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but with annoyances”
Reviews.Author: no_nomad
Reviews.Content: To be fair, I got a double through Priceline for $99, plus taxes etc., so for the money, I got a much better hotel, nicer amenities than I would have paying full price elsewhere. Front desk help was extremely pleasant and helpful when presented with a tired traveler made crankier by the extra 15 minute drive resulting from the combo of poor GPS instructions and the hotel's weird, hard-to-access, easy-to-miss location. The room itself was fine--personally, I'd prefer a bigger bedroom and smaller living room--with a view of the river (nice) and rail yards (not so much). Very comfortable beds with crisp sheets, pleasant if uninspired room, slightly shabby around the edges but clean. What bugged me, however, were things like the unavoidable (if you're driving) $35/night charge for parking--there is nowhere close that you could even try for street parking--and other money-grubbing details like $15 for WiFi. Otherwise, no real complaints--it just, all in all, felt serviceable, bland, a little greedy, and lacking anything special to make me want to come back. I know Boston hotels are expensive, but what with parking and WiFi costs, no breakfast included, the distance from neighborhoods and the T, I wound up wishing I had gone with a B & B more in the heart of things.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive for Boston, Close to Harvard”
Reviews.Author: SCN96
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband and a friend making the separate rooms nice. Able to walk to Harvard Square and people watch. Also, there is a really nice grocery store right over the bridge if you just want to grab something late/healthy. The bar was very nice, but very expensive. Woke up to see rowers on the river which just really helped give you that feeling of being close to Harvard. For the costs in Boston, I thought this was a great inexpensive place to stay. Also, we drove and found parking in Boston to be easy enough, especially in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: cdk1422
Reviews.Content: Everyone we interacted with was very pleasant and helpful. Coming from 1600 miles away and knowing nothing of the city, it was very comforting to have staff members that went out of their way to be helpful to us. The room was very spacious and comfortable, and the cookies - well, we had our share!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, be aware of the location”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoer89
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a two-night stay while on vacation with my family of four while vacationing at a few different locations in New England. The downtown Boston hotels were VERY expensive and none offered larger accommodations with a separate bedroom, etc. So, my choice was between this property and a Residence Inn on the wharf. I chose the Doubletree due to a much more competitive price, you simply couldn't beat it. The hotel is GREAT - clean, bar/restaurant, etc. The room was large and update amenities and a great view looking across the river into Cambridge. One night we walked across the bridge into Cambridge, visited the Harvard campus (AMAZING!) and had a GREAT dinner. Another night we took the shuttle into Boston, stayed late, and returned on a taxi (less than $20). The only downside of the hotel is that you can't walk into Boston, otherwise, it's an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose but don't expect what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Eloise99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we had planned a night out in Allston. Don't even contemplate this hotel if you want to enjoy what Boston has to offer. When we arrived the staff at the desk were efficient and we got to our room quickly. Even though this hotel is a little expensive I was going to give a glowing review, however ....We had planned to travel into Boston and use the T to get to the airport to begin our journey home using the hotels advertised shuttle service. When we enquired at the front desk about the service we were told their was no shuttle service. So we decided we had better get a cab to the airport so would take further advantage of our prearranged late check out and stay in our room a little longer. We were called at 2.30 (late check out being 4pm) and asked to leave!! When we left the hotel to get our cab the shuttle bus was parked outside!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay a Bit Out of the Way”
Reviews.Author: videoordvd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites for a weekend in September 2011. The hotel is in a bit of an odd location near a highway and across the river from Cambridge. They offer a free hourly shuttle to popular areas that are more centrally located, though, which made my stay much more convenient (you need to reserve a spot on the shuttle in advance). The hotel is also not too far of a walk from the Allston neighborhood, which has many bars and restaurants. The room itself was spacious and comfortable, particularly the bed. I opted for a room with a balcony rather than a suite. The view of downtown Boston from the top floor of the the hotel was definitely worth the trade! The hotel staff was helpful at check in and check out, and the warm cookies they provide were tasty. I tried calling the front desk to reserve a shuttle during my stay and no one picked up, though. This wasn't a big deal as I just went down to the desk, but was kind of weird. Overall, if the location works for you, this is a great hotel to stay at while visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: SheehanDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree for two weeks in August. The following is the best summary of the good and bad of this hotel: Good Size and layout of the suites. Nice atmosphere in the suite. Good lighting and heating works well. Comfy bed River view Close to Harvard Bar staff friendly and flexible. Very good wifi - even in the suites Not so Good Air conditioning only. No way to let fresh air into the room No grounds around the hotel. Right beside a very busy noisy road Food at main restaurant very hit and miss Breakfast uninspiring - very run of the mill. Room service stops at 11pm. Front desk staff not very engaged. Check in was functional and cold. Felt like i was being processed, not welcomed. Overall, This is a very functional hotel that is comfortable without being inspiring. As a location almost exactly between downtown and Harvard/MIT it works well but it's not a hotel you would go out of your way to recommend to friends. It's built on a very small piece of land at a very busy junction so as soon as you exit the front door you want to leave. The entrance is dominated by the adjacent car park which makes it quite ugly. Once inside an effort is made to make it seem welcoming but the design instead makes it rather cold where sounds echo and the desire is not to hang about but to head to the suite. Inside the suite, the atmosphere is good and the furnishings modern and quite fresh. The inclusion of a coffee maker, fridge and microwave is welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Double Tree quality but a little overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: RoyU
Reviews.Content: This was the only area hotel I could find with rooms available for college move in week. Price was rather steep at over $200 per night. On top of this you pay $30 per day parking. Sadly it does not even include a free continental breakfast. There are positives though. The hotel is well maintained. I previously stayed here about 15 years ago and they have kept the property updated. The room was spacious and actually was a suite with a nice sitting area and a separate bedrooom. We were on a high floor with a nice river and city view. They do have a pool and exercise room but we didn't have time to use them. My only complaint is the high room rate with nothing extra incuded such as parking, breakfast or internet. While not a problem for us since we used our car the hotel is not near any T train stop. I suspect they will shuttle you to a stop but I didn't ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk staff; Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: awmVermont
Reviews.Content: My husband's company selected this hotel for a meeting. The kids and I went along to do a whirlwind tour of Boston. The have shuttle times to Harvard Square, Copley & the Aquarium in am and pm- but nothing in the middle of the day. Walkable distance to Central Square to catch the red line(about 15 min)... and there's even a Trader Joe's across the river on Memorial Drive. If you want to be in the heart of Boston or Cambridge - this may not be the hotel for you. But pricing, suite type rooms- with fridge, shuttle and makes it affordable... and warm cookies at check-in. No breakfast was included and restaurant was pretty pricey. Only negative- pull out sleep sofa... mattress was ultra thin. not so comfy. but twin beds my daughters slept in were just fine. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RussDole
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in August, 2011. The only negative involved the complimentary shuttle. The hotel is very conveniently located for drivers, as it is 30 seconds from the highway and has ample (but expensive) parking. Since we were flying and planning to spend most of our time in Back Bay & Downtown, we decided to not rent a car & rely on the shuttle. It makes the rounds about every hour, and they suggest that you reserve your spot on it. The driver twice had to turn away riders while we were riding, as the van was full. Some people on the van had not made reservations, which would have upset me if I was denied. The driver said they are probably switching to first come/first served, which could be okay if that was a consistent policy. However, since the bus goes to Copley Square first, then Boston Commons, followed by the Aquarium, you wouldn't know if it was full if you were waiting at the third stop. The point is, ask the front desk what the policy is before planning your day. Enough negatives, here is why we would stay there again. The room was spacious, quiet, & very comfortable. We ate breakfast there once & we didn't have to eat until dinner-- it was very filling & tasty. The pool was cold, but the hot tub was wonderful after walking the streets of Boston all day. The cookies put back all the calories I walked off!! While you have to walk a long way to get anywhere, the sidewalks made it easy & gave us a great view of the Boston architecture on the way to Back Bay or Harvard. All in all the stay was exactly what we expected from a Doubletree Hotel. As our son is considering doing his collegiate work in Boston, we will probably have the pleasure of staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, clean rooms, three criticisms...”
Reviews.Author: tapny
Reviews.Content: We were happy to find a comfort sleeper instead of a spring sofa bed in the suite but it was too firm. the bed was very soft, but comfortable. The view on the Charles was pretty. The bathrooms lack a fan/ vent. The room was very dry. Our son knocked over a ceramic lamp shade in one of the hangouts, but since we were ordering food, they told us not to worry about it. Having said that, skip the tabouli- old and oily.

Reviews.Title: “Easy place for business in Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: chicagolouis
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on the Charles River. Located on a bridge, so you can easily get to Cambridge for work. Exit from parking lot puts you on an Eastbound highway, so you must go east to go west. (unless there is a simpler way)

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel, shuttle bus a saviour, shame about whirlpool”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L
Reviews.Content: A great hotel - good quality rooms and facilities. The shuttle bus is a saviour taking you to all the major parts of Boston, but a shame it stops on a Sunday afternoon at 5pm (runs until 9/10pm on other nights). Nice pool but the whirlpool was not working. Didn't eat in the hotel as very expensive - only 15 mins walk to Harvard Square for better value food.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: N2NY
Reviews.Content: First stay here and am loving the staff, the King suite, and the view of the beautiful Charles. Clean and comfortable. And even though the living room faced the interior courtyard, never heard a single sound from the outside! A first-rate front desk that has a can-do attitude with a smile. Only downside is the location is odd and not an area you want to explore on foot but it's easy to reach any area in Boston/Cambridge. Would definitely stay here again. Thank you Doubletree!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, best of all the staff. Very helpful. Good area to walk to the waterfront and some nice restaurants. We found absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation in Boston”
Reviews.Author: 5u5an
Reviews.Content: Booked Doubletree on line and had an exellent stay. Started with a warm greeting at the desk, cookies and friendly staff. Breakfast was included in our rate and was top notch - made to order omelets, fresh blueberrie pancakes - what a way to start the day. Staff was wonderful in giving directions, recommendations and tips. Room was near a T line and felt very comfortable in the neighborhood when out walking. Room itself had comfortable beds, was clean and not disturbed by noise at all even though hotel was full. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A very Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: rjam15
Reviews.Content: My sister was at a conference at Harvard and invited my 9 year old and me to come for a few days and share her room. Since this choice of hotel was out of my hands, I was worried that we would not have enough room in the hotel and without a car we would be spending a fortune on cab fare. Neither of my worries came true. This was such a nice stay. The rooms are very big. We had a large king bed and a pullout couch in the living area. the pool was clean, plenty of towels and chairs. My son and I were able to walk to Harvard Square, watch the rowers and use the hotel shuttle to get to the Aquarium area and other points of interest. The front desk was always quick to help and give the little guy and myself a warm cookie which was a nice treat, not only on check in either. The hotel shop is not that big and I recommend getting what you may need while out and about. The small restaurant/bar/starbucks was okay and I was treated very nicely when I went in. Not a full starbucks just coffee service, no baked goods etc. The hotel shuttle was very easy to use. The elevators were timely and the maid service was efficient. The concierge was helpful gave me hints on places to go with my son and even told me where to get discounted tickets (cheaper than he could acquire for me) I would stay here again. We stayed for three nights. It was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad I guess”
Reviews.Author: tvdaveyboy
Reviews.Content: I had to visit Boston for a conference for work, and they had a block of rooms at the Doubletree Boston Suites. It was an ok stay. The rooms were clean and had everything I needed, but nothing specatular to write home about. It was your average hotel. I was happy with the service, and everyone was friendly, but then again, noone went super out of their way. It was a good stay overall, and had no real complaints..just nothing over the top about it. The location was great to where i needed to be, so that was the deciding factor. The hotel was paid for by my company, and i honestly dont know what the rate was as it was all taken care of in advance. The fact that the hotel and my office had everything arranged was really helpful and took the stress of traveling off me. Overall i was satisfied with my stay and would probably stay again if i had to.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Location But Nice”
Reviews.Author: AFSpaceVet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree with my wife for one night. We were warmly greeted and given fresh chocolate chip/oatmeal cookies which were very tasty. I also caught glimpse of a Starbucks sign, which for me was a good thing as I like their coffee. It was a bit of a challenge getting in the driveway as the intersection that the hotel is located on, is very busy, plus the fact there is limited space in the entrance circle. But, once we were able to get in the driveway and checked in, we were able to easily park the car in the multi-story car park that is attached to the hotel. Keep in mind that you will be charged a moderate fee of $35 per night for parking. I was really surprised at the size of the rooms. I didn't expect the suites to be as large as they were. We had two separate rooms with a bathroom in between. We had a great view of the Charles River and the Boston area. The bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed, well appointed furnishings, and a flat screen TV. The bathroom was adequate, and fairly clean, but could use a little bit of attention to detail. Mind you, this isn't necessarily an issue with all rooms. The living room had a couch, table and chairs as well as another flat screen TV. WIFI is available in the rooms for a fee. Our room rate did not include breakfast, and we chose not to eat breakfast in the hotel the next morning. But I did have my Starbucks coffee. Likewise we did not use the restaurant on the evening we arrived. We did look at the prices which to me seemed a bit high. We chose to eat downtown as there are many other choices available with reasonable prices The hotel is within walking distance of Harvard University with easy access to the metro subway system. The hotel provides shuttle services to and from the Harvard area as well as downtown Boston which was really helpful as we didn't need to get the car out of the parking garage. Make sure you get the schedule for drop off and pick up times. The shuttle does not run to the airport, as they are not licensed as Hackney Carriages. Hackney laws prevent them from stopping at the airport, but you can get a taxi ride that will cost around $40. Alternatively you can ask the concierge for information on other private shuttle services. If you like to watch the university students rowing the competition boats, all you have to do is walk out the door, cross the street and walk to the Cambridge Street bridge. There you will see many of the rowers in training with a view to the Riverside Boat Club. Overall, I was pleased with my stay and would likely consider staying there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Murdocki
Reviews.Content: Nothing but good things to say about this hotel. Warm cookies were given at checkin and they were good! Lobby bar bartender was very welcoming and made some recommendations about where to party in Harvard Square. We didn't ask for a room with a view but got one. The room was very clean and I'm one of those people that can spy dirt at a distance. At times in the evening, the hotel atrium can be noisy from the folks going into the jazz club located within the hotel. But I didn't hear much from the room itself. The music was excellent and the club was sold out for every performance so if you want to go, plan ahead and buy tickets in advance.The pool/ whirlpool was clean and warm. The staff was great helping me with directions. I would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property even with snow!”
Reviews.Author: eelSeattle
Reviews.Content: We chose this property because of a special internet rate. It was well worth the cost and more. We understand this Doubletree is actually owned by Harvard, so it makes complete sense that it is a well-maintained, friendly and first-class property. The complimentary shuttle service to various areas of Boston was convenient and reliable. Especially given the recent snow, leaving the driving to someone else was great. We were able to navigate with ease.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Doubletrees I've experienced”
Reviews.Author: Incisive_Idiot
Reviews.Content: The property is in very good shape, the room was spotless and I daresay inviting, and the food in the Fusion bar/restaurant downstairs was decent and the bartender was friendly (though the guy who brought the food out from the kitchen didn't seem too enthused to make my acquaintance). Great views of the Charles and the skyline, though that means you're also facing Soldier's Field Road and the BU Bridge--but my white noise generator on my laptop masked the noise sufficiently (I think I was on the 17th floor but don't remember for sure). It's not as conveniently located to Boston attractions and business districts as some other Boston hotels, but a cab was waiting at 10AM on a Saturday for me (it only took 10 minutes to get to the Fenway).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with free shuttle to attractions”
Reviews.Author: laurenj2727
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights - clean, nice hotel with a pretty nice gym. All of the treadmills and ellipticals had individual tv's. The best thing about the hotel was the complimentary shuttle to harvard square and a bunch of other popular locations - it was really convenient and saved us quite a bit of money on cabs. Beautiful area where you can see all of the rowers on the river, nice conference spaces and good breakfast. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient a.d cool place!”
Reviews.Author: maui2soonBuffalo
Reviews.Content: Handy to Boston University, great view, wonderful little suite with hot cookies too. Tried to charge for internet which is free for gold members of their loyalty club. Really nice fitness center...would stag here again...great little breakfast too...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with complimentary shuttle service to attractions”
Reviews.Author: scientistmom
Reviews.Content: This is our new favorite Boston hotel. We stayed at this hotel over Easter weekend this past April. My husband and I had a suite and our 3 teenagers had their own suite also. The suites are very roomy, clean and comfortable, with a separate sitting area. Our daughters generally share the bedroom and our son gets the sofabed in the sitting area, and that way he gets his own TV and private space. We are Hilton Honors members and got some very good rates (about $100/room per night) , although even without the Honors benefits, the rooms were still very reasonable compared to rates at other Hilton properties in Boston. This hotel is actually in Cambridge, and is adjacent to the Harvard Business School. Harvard University is just a short walk away, over the Charles River. Many rooms are riverview, as well. The location is great, as it is an easy exit off of the Mass Turnpike even before you get to the complicated downtown Boston driving--I do not enjoy driving in Boston! It's a few blocks of walking to get to a T station, but the best part of the hotel (In addition to the cookies!) is the complimentary shuttle service from the hotel to various tourist attractions, such as the New England Aquarium, Copley Square and Boston Commons. Check the schedule carefully at the front desk and you can be dropped off at one of these destinations and then picked up again later in the day. Saves a lot of money and time. The hotel has a jazz club inside it, a feature we did not have an opportunity to enjoy, but it' looks very nice and had a very large crowd on one of the nights we were there. There are a couple of nice bars to relax in and our kids enjoyed room service pizza one night, while we had something more grown up! A continental breakfast was included for us as Hilton Honors members, with a very reasonable cost upgrade to the full buffet breakfast with made to order omelettes and other hot foods. The staff and service were excellent--my kids did not walk by that front desk without some warm chocolate chip cookies being offered to them! And when we were ready to leave the hotel to head home, there was no coffee availabe in the lobby at that time, but the nice ladies at the front desk ran in the back and brewed up a new pot for us and packed it in go-cups for our drive. A really nice touch indeed! We will be back for sure next time we travel to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and yet expensive”
Reviews.Author: TKTan
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was bad. Front desk is always busy and full of people. I requested complimentary comb and brush, called from my room and waited half an hour and there is no delivery. Ended i have to go down to front desk to collect. Confronted to front desk and the answer is "I m sorry i forgot". No Free Wifi and breakfast is expensive. only 1 staff manning the breakfast restaurant area and breakfast order time and served took 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: txjeffrey
Reviews.Content: I am so glad that we selected this hotel for our Memorial Day weekend visit to Boston. We were in town to move our son into MIT, and although this property is not in Cambridge, we had no problems getting around. The concierge was extremely helpful; the shuttle service was reliable and adequate; the breakfast buffet was healthy and filling; the front desk staff was so friendly and accommodating. The unlimited famous Doubletree chocolate chip cookies were addicting. The suite was very nice; I like the fact that the bathroom is not in the bedroom like it is in many Marriott Residence Inns. The whole property was very clean and attractive. When we checked in the front desk upgraded us at no charge to a riverfront room. The view was just spectacular. If we return to Boston, we will definitely stay at the Doubletree. If anyone has any questions, I will be happy to reply. You will not go wrong if you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not really close to anywhere”
Reviews.Author: KeroppiQueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip, and had a good time. The staff hotel was very friendly when I arrived. They provided me with the free chocolate cookies. In addition, the staff assisted with a shuttle reservation for pickup and drop off. FYI - The complimentary shuttle goes to Copley Square, Boston Common, New England Aquarium, and Harvard Square. The room was nice and spacious. Even though I traveled by myself, I really enjoyed using the suite to use my laptop and watch tv. The bed was comfy, and it was easy for me to fall asleep. In addition, the bathroom was clean. I liked the Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. Fancy stuff. The room also had a coffee pot, micro fridge, microwave, and TVs. I didn't like the hotel too much since the location was not close to anything. There weren't any restaurants within walking distance. I ate at the hotel restaurant for two nights in a row. In addition, the hotel isn't near a bus or train line, so it was a $40 taxi ride for 7 miles. If you bring a car, parking in the garage was over $30. Otherwise, just wait for a taxi. You also need to pay for wifi. I paid $9.95 for 24 hours. You could use free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, quiet”
Reviews.Author: runpmc
Reviews.Content: I used Hilton points to book a room so I wouldn't have to drive home following a Red Sox game. I last stayed in this hotel back in 2001 and enjoyed my stay then, so figured I'd give it another whirl. Like most chain hotels, the carpet and furnishings are a little dated but I was simply there to sleep and have a short commute into work. The bed was very comfortable, though I needed two pillows as one alone just was too flat. Bathroom was very clean, I'd have no problems staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust221
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay if you have business in Cambridge or Watertown. The service is top-notch. When you check-in, they are professional, helpful and give you a warm baked cookie. I had a slight problem with my toilet and they repaired it immediately AND gave me free room service in recognition for the inconvenience. Overall, I gave this very high ratings because of the service. The room is nice, but make sure to ask for a King (or queen) suite, as you don't want a room with twin beds. The suite is a bonus because it has an extra room with flatscreen tv/sofa bed. Also ask for a room overlooking the river -- very nice to wake up and see the crew team practicing along the Charles.

Reviews.Title: “This place is OK, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: TheButterflyEffect75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Doubletree two times, and honestly there is nothing special to say about the place. The room was OK, service was OK, location is good (close to the Harvard campus), breakfast... well, almost OK (too heavy for an European). The prices are resonable.

Reviews.Title: “Lacked attention to detail considering the price and it's a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: twestheimer
Reviews.Content: We had stayed there some years ago with our children and like it but we revisited with our granddaughter. and were disappointed. We had a suite and when we called to get help opening the foldout couch the front desk never answered and the housekeeping said they would send someone up and after 20+minutes we just figured it out. When calling to cancel they never said 'sorry' etc. At the pool there were no towels until we asked for more and again I felt they were not keeping an eye on this kind of thing. Finally the restaurant is expensive for the costs. As they are far from any other restaurants I guess they have a captive audience. The view was good but location was too far from many things.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business, absolutely boring for leisure.GREAT STAFF!!”
Reviews.Author: Sil2006
Reviews.Content: My husband had a training in Harvard and this was perfect location for the purpose. It is WALKING DISTANCE to HARVARD. The hotel has good facilities, a nice lobby and restaurant and shuttles to main attracctions and sites in Boston for free. My kid and I were not so pleased with the hotel choice as we were there for leisure and it is not good for this: it is far from almost everything except for Harvard, no cafes or shops around. And the hotel itself lacks infrastructure: the bar is quite limited, the shop is really a small corner by the reception where they have put some bottles, medicines and chocolates. There is not even a cappucino available at the hotel. In room TV is so limited! Just 35 channels and no one for kids! So, if you have to spend a while inside the hotel, it will be quite boring. Rooms are large, not very new but comfortable. Fridge, minibar and microwave. Bed is very good. Bathrooms are ok. Not luxurious at all but clean and comfortable. Staff is UNBELIEVABLE! They are warm, kind, always smiling, always trying to help. They care so much for you that they come to offer help even when you are not asking them for it. I donÂ´t know if it was because my kid and me were wandering along the hotel all day and they are not used to have families (just business people), but they seemed to be delighted to have us (especially my kid) there and they offered warm cookies, cokes and coffee for free all the time. The shuttle used to stop at noon. Once, I had to go to the aquarium at noon and there was not shuttle service until 3 pm: well, they took us to the aquarium just to help us. This hotel has such a great service that they made me love the hotel and the brand even when I usually prefer more luxurious ones. Good for people and for the manager! As a conclusion: perfect for business, great service. If your plan is leisure, pick some other hotel near downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: AndyTE
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to Boston I stay here and have yet to be disappointed! Great location and nice accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suites”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: After looking at some other hotels in Cambridge that had astronomical rates, I found this DoubleTree (which was reasonably priced, especially in comparison) and wondered a bit what might be wrong with it. The answer: nothing! My stay was very nice. As a Diamond Hilton HHonors member, I was given a suite on the top floor of the hotel and my room actually had two levels -- a main level with a small living room and a loft level with the bed. All of this was very nice, and the views were spectacular. Decor was fine; bed was comfortable. The bathroom was AWESOME -- really great style and a shower that included sprayers in the wall. A nice touch of luxury! Not sure if this bathroom is in every room or was an upgraded feature of the room to which I was assigned. The hotel has a large atrium, which always gives a hotel a nice, airy feel. The lobby is a bit small and a little on the cramped side. Service at check-in was excellent. I was especially impressed that as a line built 2 additional staff members immediately came out of the back to help process check-ins, moving the line very quickly. I had a breakfast meeting in the restaurant. The service was good and the buffet was of high quality. After the breakfast meeting, a colleague and I met in one of the hotel's common spaces to continue our conversation. A manager approached us to explain that the space would soon be noisy due to some renovations going on in the hotel's bar. It was nice of him to warn us...but I was especially impressed when he offered us one of the hotel's empty meeting rooms to finish up our work. The hotel's parking is in a garage that was full enough I had to go to the top floor during my stay, but since there's an elevator connecting the garage to the lobby this wasn't a big deal. Overall, this was a very nice visit -- and a great value. Good job, DoubleTree.

Reviews.Title: “Operational Issues”
Reviews.Author: Retailwonderer
Reviews.Content: I generally like the DoubleTree brand, but this particular hotel is not up to their standards. Pros: - Good layout, large rooms, and true suites. It appears to have been an Embassy Suites in the past. - Comfortable and functional furnishings - Modern lobby area - Fast elevators Cons: - The internet service was the worst Iâ€™ve ever experienced in a hotel. It dropped and reconnected literally every 2 minutes for the hour in the evening and again the next morning that I attempted to use it. I called the 800 support number but no one ever answered. - The heating unit was very noisy. It clunked loudly like an A/C compressor every time it cycled. - Even though I paid for parking when I checked in, my key did not work when exiting or entering the parking garage. The front desk reprogrammed it and then it worked when I left. - The bedside clock was approximately 1 hour off and there was no way to adjust it. There were no radio stations set on the pre-set buttons. - The guest room door closure mechanisms are worn out, allowing the doors to slam loudly when people entered and exited their rooms. - The TV in my bedroom did not receive any channels. (The one in the living room worked fine.) - Soundproofing on the windows is inadequate, allowing highway noise to intrude. - In the morning, I found the doors from the lobby to the parking garage were blocked off with a sign saying go the 2nd level. Since Iâ€™d already parked on the ground level the night before, this was inconvenient. I have no idea why they did this. - When checking out, I was prepared to share my concerns with the front desk staff, but they never asked me how my stay was. I think the property has the potential to be good, but I wonâ€™t stay there again until I know theyâ€™ve made the necessary improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Highs and Lows”
Reviews.Author: Skylark73
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and very comfortable for two people. The room had two flat screen TV's plus a microwave and a nice supply of coffee and tea. The view of Harvard University and the Charles River was excellent (we were on one of the upper floors). Boston was very cold and windy when we were there, and unfortunately, the heater in the room never did seem to warm up the room. Still, the comforter on the bed was a perfect weight for sleeping. One odd thing about the hotel (or at least our room) was that the water pressure for the toilet was extremely weak...you literally had to flush several times to clear the bowl, and even then, it was never a sure thing! There was free internet access in the business center, but not in the rooms. Many other Hilton properties offer free Wi-Fi in the rooms...why is it so expensive here? The buffet breakfast ($20.00) had a wide range of items, but overall I felt it was overpriced, e.g., the scrambled eggs were cold, and the fresh fruit wasn't very ripe. We ended up driving to a McDonald's on the second morning of our stay. The location is pretty close to everything (e.g., the Harvard campus is just a few minutes by car and about a 15 to 20 minute walk on very nice sidewalks). So, in some ways, the hotel is nicely situated, but on the other hand, the property sits amongst several very busy roads on what seems to be the middle of a cloverleaf. There were no stores or restaurants in the immediate vicinity, so if you want to run out for a quick snack or whatever, it is necessary to drive. There is only one way out of the parking lot and, with the traffic, it was not easy to get out of it of by car. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, but there was a long wait at check-in and the concierge seemed to be pulling double duty at front desk. All in all, the room was comfortable, the hotel was clean, and our stay was mostly fine...just not quite as good as other Hilton properties I've stayed at in the past year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Carbfree
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with just a few problems. They were very understaffed. The desk person not only had to run the desk, but run the concierge desk and the candy store as well. The shuttle services worked less than promised. Be warned it does not run "frequently" as we were told, it runs every hour and you need to make reservations. It also ends fairly early so you'll need to cab it to get back. The parking is crazy high ($35) but in line with other hotels. Their policy on computers is nuts too. They charge $10 for each IP address, which means if you have your laptop but want to use the wifi on your cell and your kid has an Ipod with wifi, you will pay $30 a day. The worst policy I've ever seen. You can use your computer for free in the lobby but it's a bit crowded. The room was fairly clean and well-appointed but the bathrooms could have used more attention. The grout between the tiles in the tub were a bit on the moldy side. The bed was heaven. We had a suite with a separate bedroom and my wife and I loved the King bed with feather top and the pillows were feathered and the best we ever had. My daughter had the pullout couch and she said it was less than comfortable. The staff is friendly and courteous but, as I said, understaffed. The one down-side was the driver of the shuttle. He was gruff and unhelpful and the only words I ever heard him say were, "Did you make a reservation?" My wife and I called him the Shuttle Guard. The pool seemed nice (we didn't actually use it because it was packed with families with kids and was a bit noisy. If you're a business traveler or just someone who wants to take a quiet dip in the pool you might have more luck on a weekday or when kids are in school. The location is good. Just outside the city and close to Cambridge but forget about running out to a local store for breakfast. You'll need a car. On the whole the hotel is beautiful but suffers from short-sighted management. I was told the hotel was full so you'd think they might have staffed up a bit. There was also quite a bit of mis-communication. We called the hotel twice and again at the desk and asked about the shuttle service each time and no one ever gave us a direct answer. We spent probably $80 on cabs because a driver called in sick one day, or the shuttle stopped working or it was just too crowded. They were apologetic but it was a cold February day and we weren't too happy.

Reviews.Title: “THINK TWICE!!”
Reviews.Author: MSPtoATL
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Hilton Honors member and I can say that this hotel is the worst one I have stayed in so far. I will breakdown the sequence of events and why you should think twice before choosing this hotel. LOCATION: Very poor. It is near nothing and close to nothing. The street outside the hotel is very busy and a cab must be taken everywhere. ROOM SERVICE: perhaps its just me, but does room service start early? 7:30 is a little early to be knocking on doors. I made sure to put my DND sign up the next day. HOTEL LAYOUT: The layout of this hotel makes it VERY noisy. If you have three people, the person sleeping on the sofa bed, will hear everytime a neighbor closes the doors, will smell the breakast food on the 2nd floor (we were on the 7th), will hear loud banging at all hours of the night. The layout is an interior corridor layout so it appears that noise is transferred very easily in this hotel since it is missing walls and insulaiton. ROOMS: Rooms were clean, and housekeeping prompt so no complaints there. However, for a "suite" you would expect a separate sink (other than bathroom) but there were none. Bathrooms had adequate counterspace. BREAKFAST: Buffet is not worth 19.95, but of course since you are in the middle of nowhere you have no other options INTERNET: 9.95/DAY CABS: Cab drivers frequent this hotel so that will not be a problem. Our issue was that cab drivers seemed very picky and would ask you where you are going and then would decide whether or not they wanted to take you. Make sure they turn on their meters as soon as you get in the car. OTHER: There was a loud banging through the walls of our hotel room. It started at 3 a.m. and continued until 7 a.m. The maintenance engineer was called and he could not determine the problem. Initially the thought was that the banging in the wall was coming from the pipes, but this was refuted by the engineer, so therefore we had to put up with the screeching noise in the wall all night as the hotel was sold out and there were no other rooms to switch to. The maintenance engineer did his due diligence and even offered us free breakfast coupons for our lack of sleep because of this issue. But it is very disappointing that the promised call from the hotel manager never came. Nor did he call and check up on our status as we were greatly inconvenient. I will be writing a little to the Hilton headquarters as well as to the GM of this hotel, this evening. Then there was a FIRE ALARM on Saturday evening/afternoon. Seriously??!!! When is the last time you have experienced a fire alarm in a hotel? This definitely gives you hints as to the type of guests you will be staying with as well as the caliber of this hotel. My recommendation: PAY THE EXTRA MONEY!! Stay on the other side of the bridge near Harvard Square or Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyHynes
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for just one evening and booked a room at the Doubletree Hotel based solely on the low online price. I have to say that it was a huge suprise when I arrived and saw the size of my room and the amenities that the hotel had to offer. Overall the room was clean and well appointed. The lobby was huge and the atrium impressive. There is a jazz club on the thrid third floor that was great. Though the hotel isn'y in the center of Boston and not convenient to the T, I would still stay there again. Downside... the parking was very expensive and the gate was malfunctioning as I checked in and had not been fixed when I left.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: ELJ77
Reviews.Content: out dated room.worn carpet and drapes.shabby sleep sofa i was shocked.rooms need a major renovation

Reviews.Title: “We needed two rooms, and this fit the bill for the price”
Reviews.Author: cmm_travels
Reviews.Content: All in all, a nice night at the hotel. Rooms were good size, enough elevators for the size of the hotel. Bathroom was fine, was good to have kitchenette/microwave area. Looks like updated recently with new tvs, etc. So if you need a night in boston with a suites arrangement and do not want to stay in Back Bay, a good alternative. Didn't have any mice experiences like what I read recently ( were on 14th floor) Biggest sticking point is parking (tights spaces, pricey $35/night, up $5 from last year). Seems like they want to lure you out of the Back Bay with decent room rate but you're going to end up giving it back for parking, etc.) Unfortunately, cookies were not offered on check in, had to go back down to request them.

Reviews.Title: “No mice, but no hot water either”
Reviews.Author: ladodgerone
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here on business. Was happy to have a room that was out of the way from the noise and elevators. Checkin was rather slow and the lobby was packed with people waiting for cabs. Room needed a little updating but at least there were no mice (the other trip advisor reviews were scaring me). Window side of suite got cold at times. Really found the automatic-power-off-in-room annoying, since it impeded my ability to keep the laptop up and running while I was out of the room. Wifi for $10/day is a ripoff. Gym was much better than the hotel's website pictures indicate--one side with ~10 precor machines (each machine with an individual television) and the other side with assorted dumbbells and weight machines. This was a very pleasant surprise. In-room breakfast service did not come at the appointed time, nor was it anywhere near the $20 price. A little difficult to catch a cab at times. Great proximity to Harvard Business School, but not much else (and in the winter, there is nothing in walkable distance). Price for the room was absurd for a doubletree, but that may be exploitation due to the time of year (recruiting season for students; they have a captive audience).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: annoncapecod
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in the Doubletree Guest Suites on Soldiers Field Road over Christmas. We had been to this resort previously as we like having a suite. It provides us each some privacy and in this case it allowed my daughter an extra room to entertain some visiting friends. At check in warm chocolate chip cookies are provided (and I have to admit we asked for more than our check-in cookie!) The hotel is immaculate, comfortable and very well located, half way between Harvard Sq. Cambridge and the Back Bay in Boston. It has a fridge, microwave, coffee and coffee pot, small bottles of Neutrogena shampoo, etc. , hairdryer. At one point I asked for fresh towels and extra coffee and they were delivered with a smile within five minutes. There is a charge for internet but I asked if there was a code I could use and they provided it and did not charge me. There is Starbucks coffee in the lobby in the morning. It says there is a charge but I was never charged for my coffees and I didn't really see that anyone else was. We made use of the hotel shuttles to both locations.(Boston & Cambridge) (Shuttles run on a schedule so check ahead. ) Unfortunately this hotel does not have a shuttle to/from the airport so factor in that expense. Coming from the airport it was $40, (various tolls factored in) going back was $30. Parking is a bit hefty at $35 a night so we made use of a combination of the shuttle, taxis and subway to get around. I would return to this hotel for its convenience, cleanliness, suites and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The Bar....”
Reviews.Author: comeongetrealkitty
Reviews.Content: The quality of service at the bar has decreased significantly in the past several months. Cleanliness no longer. Drinks, place settings, etc. sit at the bar for way too long after someone's left the bar. I had to ask that my place be cleaned 20 mins after I finished eating. Glasses full of coke, wine, or whatever the drink may have been are left on the back of the bar. No wonder there aren't any clean glasses!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: busytraveller2008
Reviews.Content: Majorly happy with this hotel and if I was to visit Boston would look it up again. The suite was big enough for 3 people but it was just myself staying this time. Pool, gym and bar/restaurant would thoroughly recommend with great service. Location was a bit out of the way and so I had to get taxi's to downtown Boston etc, but that was the only disadvantage. Ate in the terrace bar quite a few times and loved the red wine ;)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: polarbear24
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an open interior, so was concerned about noise, but bedroom is far from hallway and was very quiet. Very comfortable bed. Good size room. Two tvs. Room was dusted and vacuumed but needs a good "spring cleaning". Worst thing - went to go to sleep first night and discovered sheets were NOT fresh sheets - EWWWWWWW. Seriously? How that can be overlooked?Lady who came from housekeeping was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel but too far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: Swissworld_traveller
Reviews.Content: The great lobby, the mezzanine, the welcome cookie at check-in, the beautiful big rooms (actually suites) with great amenities, the great room service, the cleanliness... This hotel is definitely a very good one which is quite affordable. Unfortunately, it is badly located. You need a 10-15 minutes walk to Harvard Square where you can catch the metro. There is a free shuttle service operating at given schedules, so it is not really convenient. And why do we have to pay for high-speed wireless internet ?

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Aurora1101
Reviews.Content: There were many benefits to this hotel- suites (good for putting small children to bed before parents), shuttle (with VERY courteous, thoughtful drivers- though you have to schedule everything in advance), GREAT housekeeping staff (the best I've ever had in a hotel), nice view of the river (and the traffic next to it). The downsides were- The pool was COLD, and the hottub was cool. The restaurants were VERY expensive ($20/person for the breakfast buffet- we ended up buying peanutbutter and yogurt for our room instead), the parking was $35/day, Internet was $10/day (we didn't indulge), the bathroom didn't have a fan and the closest T stop was a 15 minute walk, over some rough sidewalk terrain (hard with the stroller) and if there was anything going on downstairs in the conference area you could hear it in your livingroom, along with all the doors on the floor slamming shut. The concierge was always very helpful. The frontdesk amended the bill quickly when we were overcharged compared to the rate we booked over the phone. The shuttle was a nice way to get into town, though we found trying to schedule our returns too difficult and just took the subway and walked. Overall, we had a good time and it served its purpose of a good home-base for a long weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “nice view of the river”
Reviews.Author: mad155
Reviews.Content: I flew into Boston late thursday night and cabbed over to this hotel. If i was in town longer would have really liked to try out the shuttle service. I can only comment on the room because that is all i really had a chance to enjoy. Check-in was prompt and i got my cookie. Room was very big and roomy and overlooked the Charles river. There was some wear and tear in the carpet but nothing major. The bathroom was also nice and the water pressure was great. the only downside is that when doors are left to slam shut it does shake the room. People please do not let your door slam shut. you are not at home.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Guest Suite Boston Oct 2010”
Reviews.Author: bower007
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed at a Doubletree before so this was my first experience with them. The hotel was pretty big, very clean and seemed very busy during my three days there. The hotel has a nice wide open feel to it; there is a restaurant and a jazz club which really surprised me, though I did not have time to stay and watch any performances. There is a small bar with a sitting area which was cozy, and the bar staff were very pleasant. The room itself was big, with a front sitting area containing a chair, couch and decent sized flat panel HDTV. The bathroom is nothing special to speak of; it's your usual plain, white tiled bathroom with one sink, toilet and shower/tub. The bedroom was a good size; my room had a king size bed which was very comfortable. The bedroom also had it's own HDTV, though it was smaller than the one in the front sitting area. A desk for sitting/working at finished off the bedroom. I splurged on in room dining one night, which was all it took to find out how expensive room service was. A small bowl of clam chowder, chicken parm and a bottle of beer was over $40; till I added a tip it exceeded $50. The food was mediocre at best; definitely not worth the $50 + I paid. Wireless internet is $10, and I was charged $20 for parking daily; $60 for three days which I find to be very inappropriate. The room rate was ok, but it's due to the conference I was attending was given a discount for a block of rooms; I believe the normal rate would have cost me up to $80 or more a night. All in all, I did like the hotel; I had no issues what so ever and would consider staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal size of suite. Like an apartment!”
Reviews.Author: JuneHawaii
Reviews.Content: Great views of the charles River & Harvard. Walk to Harvard Square in 25 minutes...scenic along the Charles. window do not open, but that is okay. Appreciated the free business center wit h free internet, but parking fee of $30/ night was steep. Really nice appointed bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location NO PROBLEM!”
Reviews.Author: cassierowan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the doubletree guest suites for one week, and the hotel was just what we were after! Due to budget we saved a lot of money by staying at this hotel, and would definitely recommend doing so if you are in the same boat. The hotel was really nicely presented, with nice staff, bar and lounge and the rooms (we had standard) were a great size, really clean, nice bathroom and we were lucky enough to have a beautiful view out of the Charles river! There is also a small pool with a jacuzzi which we loved - it is open till 10pm and is perfect for relaxing after long day sight seeing! It is important to mention the location of the hotel, after we ourselves were freaked out after booking by people mentioning how bad the location is and reccomending that we try to book elsewhere- but don't fret it is FINE! Option one: They have a really good and extensive shuttle bus service which takes you into different parts of the city, and only takes around 10 minutes to do so. You do have to prebook your seat for the times you want, so if you are organised or have a family this is a perfect way to do it. (N.B there was always spaces for when we wanted, so capacity doesn't seem an issue). Option two: You can take the T, to Central Square and then walk about one mile (along River street) to the hotel. The route is basically straight along the one road and doesn't take that long. On route there are two supermarkets if you want to stock up on water etc! We used to take this option on the way home to give us flexibilty when we wanted to return instead of prebooking a shuttle time, and we even walked it late at night and always felt safe! You could always take a taxi from Central Square too if you wanted. Word of warning- I wouldn't recommend this route if with young children as the road crossings at some points aren't that well planned out (mainly the first crossing from the hotel. In a nutshell the hotel was great, saved us lots of money, location is not an issue and it was perfect for our amazing, full packed stay in the beautiful city of Boston :) We would recommend to families, couples, short business trips, and for those who like to spend their holiday out and about exploring and keep their hotel for sleeping! Any questions I will be happy to answer!

Reviews.Title: “My most frequented hotel in Boston but not necessarily my favorite”
Reviews.Author: crimfan
Reviews.Content: Somewhat convienent to Cambridge, usually use cab or shuttle to get across the river but it is walkable to get to the "t" at harvard Square (about 20 minutes). Parking charge is outrageously high. Sometimes their room rates spike to the unaffordable range (i.e. regatta weekend).

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lilfoot2
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious, views overlooking the Charles and Cambridge were beautiful. Loved the shuttle bus - very convenient! Easy on/off to Mass Pike as well. Enjoyed the seating areas on the 2nd floor atrium. We never did eat at the hotel - couldn't afford an $80 breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Mice....Yuck”
Reviews.Author: stacyh34328
Reviews.Content: !st let me say we have stayed here several times without incident... but this last stay was horrible... we were there for 2 weeks (normal for us) the 1st 8 nights were ok... then we started seeing mice.. they brought us traps and we actually caught mice... they moved is up to another room thinking that would help... but not... we had mice in that room too.. once again they moved us up... and so far that seemed to help.... the thought of mice in your room running around all over your personal items is disgusting... but I will give the staff kudos.. they were and always have been very accomodating to us... they never hesitated to do what they could to make right the wrong... the hotel is a nice place with alot of nice amenities... if they can get the mice problem under control would be ok.. but for what its worth there seem to be those large "rat boxes" outside of every establishment, Starbucks included.. so maybe the problem is within Boston itself... another good is it is pet friendly...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: howergm
Reviews.Content: Check-in was smooth and front desk staff was fairly helpful. Rooms were clean and well kept, rooms on the east side of the hotel have fantastic views of the river, Cambridge, and Downtown. The property is a bit out of the way from the main parts of the city, but it was easy enough to hop on a bus to Central Square and take the T wherever we needed to go. Overall it was a good stay for my wife and I, and given the rate we obtained we would not have a problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Annoying, vermin infested hotel!”
Reviews.Author: v1ct0r1a_soph
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, myself and my 2yr old daughter) stayed in this hotel while in the middle of a move to the city, waiting for our belongings to get to our new home.... It was a very annoying and disgruntling stay. First off, the hotel is INFESTED with MICE!!! We saw them multiple times including in our ROOM! When we called the front desk to complain/alert them, all they did was send an engineer with mouse traps. They barely said 'sorry'!!! It is obvious that they get many such complaints every day. The engineer said we could change rooms but it was night time and our daughter was already asleep, not to mention we'd been living there for a few days already and it would be awful to change rooms. We also aren't dumb and know if there's a mouse here, there's mice in other rooms, too. Housekeeping was a nightmare. We expected our trash to be emptied and our room refreshed (new toiletries, coffee, beds made) every day and atleast 2 or 3 days of our 6 day stay had us calling the front desk and demanding house keeping's attention. The hotel is loud- we could hear the jazz bar every night from our room. And don't even THINK about napping in the day because housekeeping hangs out in the hallways and flirts with engineering (no wonder the rooms are dirty and there are mice- no one is doing their job!) All this at a very expensive hotel. It felt like they nickle and dimed us every chance they could get- wireless internet ($10/day) parking ($30/day) early cancellation fee ($75).... even the coffee in the lobby was $2!!! A few pluses- the pool was great, nice hot tub. Great location (for us, anyway to get to the new house). Also, the lobby was beautiful with a sixteen floor skylight.
