My daughter loved watching the bank of 4 glass elevators go up and down up and down (sitting in the hallway doing this was when we saw our first mouse). There is an excellent restaurant in the hotel, but it's VERY expensive- $19 for the breakfast buffet!!! And room service is not only expensive but they charge you $3 for the delivery PLUS 15% gratuity PLUS meal tax. I've never encountered this in a hotel (charge for delivery plus charged gratuity). On the last note, we were told by 4 different people calling our room from outside lines that it was very inconvenient to try and get ahold of a room and that the front desk was always rude! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for family event”
Reviews.Author: Tenley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for our son's wedding, which was also held at the hotel. The catering staff were wonderful to work with and it was a delightful weekend and event, including the wedding's rooftop cocktail hour and the nicely arranged brunch the next morning. The staff was also extremely helpful in arranging hotel shuttles to the rehearsal dinner off site. The hotel suites were comfortable and spacious, definitely a good value. And comfortable bedding. Overall the staff was friendly and helpful and we got a lot of positive feedback from wedding guests staying at the hotel. The location is quirky, but it's close to everything by car or shuttle. There's a drug store and Whole Foods just across the river, a five minute walk, which was convenient. And the views from the upper floors are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hengie
Reviews.Content: Quick check-in; 2-room suite nicely appointed, roomy. We traveled with 3 other couples, so there was always somewhere to comfortably gather at the end of a day of sightseeing. 2 flat screen TV's, refrigerator, coffee maker in room; fantastic mattress. No noise problems at night. Staff was very nice. This hotel is away from the downtown area, (approx. 2 miles) but prices are very good comparatively. The earlier you book, the better your price will be. Self-parking was $30/day with in/out priviledges, but the hotel provided great free shuttle service. More than worth the parking fee. Once we checked in, we never needed our car until we left. The shuttle is on a regular schedule with several drop off / pick up points all around town and friendly drivers who will point you in the right direction when you get off. The hotel restaurant's breakfast was not cheap - $15 for an omelet, $19.99 for the breakfast buffet, but it was a great buffet, with omelets and waffles made to order. Great fitness center - no problem getting on the machines. All four couples would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, responsive staff, and some views of the Charles...”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler40
Reviews.Content: -- Basic hotel -- feels like it is used a lot -- feels a bit like an airport hotel - Restaurant staff were EXTREMELY friendly - Perhaps a bit too busy at times-- two glasses stayed outside my door for two days -- they were there when I checked in! To their credit, when I let them know -- they were gone in 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: 4staronly
Reviews.Content: After travelling from Ireland with 2 kids under 2, arriving at this hotel was a pleasant and welcomed surprise! We hired a car, and it was only a 5 min drive from the airport. Access to the car park was very easy (parking is $30 a night). Check-in was very quick. The room was excellent; spacious living area, big bathroom and bed room. Not sure how easy it was to walk anywhere (just at the end of the freeway) but it was perfect for anyone driving. Ate in the bar the first night, really nice food and prices not too bad for a hotel. Service was excellent through-out. overall it was a great start to our vacation :)

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but a bit isolated”
Reviews.Author: ginsoc
Reviews.Content: the hotel is quite out of the way from Central Boston, a quite a long walk to Cambridge. However the hotel does provide free shuttle bus to and from hotel to quite a few hot-spots in Central and Cambridge. You do need to book it, but we booked our return trip at 7pm for 9pm and it was fine. The lobby looks grand, but can't say the same for the rooms, we were on the 2nd floor. Not that it's ugly or unclean, just expected more glam from Hilton. But it does have a living room and a separate bed room (single beds). It has a microwave and fancy coffee machine. If you are out sightseeing all day long, then it is sufficient. Although it cost $13 to get wifi in the room, but it's free in the lobby. And let just say the signal in the lobby is quite strong.... that it reached the 2nd floor.... hum hum... There is a multi-storey carpark by the hotel which you have to pay to park at $30 a day. Conclusion: comfortable, sufficient, a bit far, pro: shuttle bus, con: pay for carpark.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL, ODD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: INTANDEMBIKES
Reviews.Content: No problems with Hotel. Very Nice breakfast buffet. Great view of Boston Skyline. Hard to find entrance to Hotel due to highway on ramps. Can't walk to downtown but able to do long walk to Harvard. 15 minute walk to subway. Hotel has a shuttle that will take you Downtown and Harvard approx every hour till 9pm but must reserve this. Our room was clean with lots of space. No Bellman greeted us when we arrived so we took our luggage up ourselves. Only parking is their garage with a $30 fee pr night...ouch.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and good location”
Reviews.Author: abofreeman
Reviews.Content: I will admit the intersection is a bit dangerous immediately outside the hotel, but the hotel is a very short walk to the Harvard/Cambridge area and probably a 10min walk to the Central Square Red Line stop. From there you can get anywhere on the T. We actually walked to Fenway on a bicycle trail that runs along the river. It was probably about 2.5 miles, but very walkable for someone who is inclined to walk to save money. We took a cab back and it was about $8.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and spacious - and great for families”
Reviews.Author: familyontour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of July - I'd booked having read other reviews and I must admit that the hotel was even better than I'd expected. We found the rooms were bright and spacious and the beds (even the double sofa bed) were really comfortable. The staff were friendly and courteous throughout - giving in to the kids' demands for cookies every night! We didn't eat in the restaurant but we did bring lunch back from the excellent Whole Foods store one day (my only gripe is that the hotel should really provide some plates and cutlery as well as a microwave and refrigerator). As regards location, I would ignore all those who said that you need a car. That's nonsense - it was only a 20 minute stroll to Harvard Square and 15 minutes to the T stop at Central Square. Also we were able to walk back from Fenway. And we made great use of the little shuttle bus - it took us to Harvard one night (we ate at the John Harvard which was great) and picked us up again at 21.45. We also used it to go downtown - from there a short stroll to Fenway - but we also made good use of the T as the last bus leaves downtown at 21.10 which was a bit early if having a meal out. Also, for a very reasonble charge, the hotel arranged for the shuttle bus to take us to the airport when we were leaving. So, in short, I wouldn't hesitate to rebook if I had a chance to revisit Boston (what a wonderful city). The kids enjoyed the pool - they usually had it to themselves - and we loved the spaciousness that the atrium design gives to the lobby areas.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay for the Fourth of July”
Reviews.Author: goodrzy
Reviews.Content: I have e-mailed the manager of this Doubletree and Hilton Customer Service and received no reply. My family and I have been staying at the Doubletree for many years whenever we go to Boston. Frustrations/annoyances have been minimal. Our stay on July 4 came close to erasing the good experiences. When I came to check in, the young woman said ,â€�Oh, youâ€™re already checked in.â€� I asked her how that could be, since we just got there. She answered that it was â€œprobably some sort of Hilton Honors thing.â€� I was not asked for a photo id or my charge card. That seemed very odd to me. During my whole stay I never signed anything other than the restaurant tab. I was given keys to room on the eighth floor, so we went up there only to find people already in the room. So I went back downstairs to the desk. The staffer who gave me keys to another room didnâ€™t seem to understand why I was upset and insisting that he make sure that I was only being billed for one room. I was also upset because I had made a reservation for a high corner room with a river view so we could see the aerial display for the fireworks. The desk clerk told me that you can't see the fireworks from the Doubletree. A lie -- since we watched them from our room last year. At no point did he take any responsibility for the error. I asked for breakfast coupons and he gave them to me for breakfast the next day. We were assigned another, which was hot. In fact, it kept getting hotter. We called the desk who sent maintenance who worked on the air conditioner for a little while and things seemed to get better. When we came back from Fenway that night, the room was very hot and the sofa bed didnâ€™t want to work, so we called downstairs and maintenance came up again. The room never got below 80 degrees that night. In the morning before we left for an afternoon game, I went to the desk to complain again. When we came back from the game, the room was slightly cooler. As the evening wore on, the temperature crept up above 80 degrees. So I went downstairs again. This time I spoke with the night manager who was genuinely concerned and who cut the price of our stay in half and offered me a free night if I could stay on. He also sent up fans which made that night more bearable. He had the only positive customer service attitude that I encountered among the desk staff. Having said all this, I would rather have paid the full price and gotten the room I had reserved. I had been looking forward to this weekend ever since 2009 when we spent the Fourth of July in your hotel, and the desk staff at check in came close to ruining it for me. Also â€“ we never received any cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: SprinfgieldMass
Reviews.Content: We were looking for the ideal hotel to stay for our visit to the Science Museum. The DoubleTree on Soldiers Field Rd is PERFECT. There is a multi-level self-park garage on the hotel property. You pay a flat rate ($30.00/day) and just swipe your room card to come and go as often as you please. It was 3-minutes, straight down Memorial Dr and into Museum Garage. Also, the hotel is located practically ON the Mass Turnpike, and minutes from other highways. We ate in Hotel Restaurant (Green Terrace?) for breakfast and dinner. The meals were superb and reasonably priced. The rooms were fresh and modern decor. The staff was as accomodating as you'd expect at The Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: VFMtraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel claimed to be minutes from MIT but this was true only if you had your own car. They have a shuttle but it goes to Harvard square and nor MIT. The hotel is inconveniently located. You are totally dependent on their shuttle if you want to explore Boston & Cambridge unless you have a car (parking charges at the hotel & in Boston are steep) or want to take a taxi. The rooms were good, but they charge for internet. They do have free internet in the lobby on their computers. Breakfast was good and HHonors members get a discount!

Reviews.Title: “Bitten by Bugs - no followup”
Reviews.Author: sekaitrips
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was okay. The positives: close to the Harvard campus; roomy suite, clean bathroom, good housekeeping service; free coffee and bottled water in the room; comfortable bed; a free shuttle service to Boston's Copley Square area, the Harvard Square and aquarium. What could be improved: The check-in service was average but not particularly friendly and the much advertised free cookies were not offered to us. The comfortable bed and what would have been six nights of good rest was abruptly marred late one evening by loud screaming and noise in the corridors - the result of people partying and running around the floors at 2 am. We had to call the front desk to complain. We had an upgrade for a free breakfast each morning which was a nice perk but the breakfast offered the same array of foods each day and the dining room staff (with the exceptiuon of one Latino lady) were not friendly. The other troubling incident was a bout of bad bug bites. On our check out day we mentioned the bug bites and were enthusiastically assured by the young receptionist at the front desk that a manager would definitely be calling us. It's been two days and we're still waiting. Although the hotel was conveniently located close to campus, crossing the streets each day to get to campus involved dodging traffic and fearing for your life. Cars drive very fast and don't slow down for pedestrians. The hotel should perhaps inquire about installing speed bumps on the road that runs outside the hotel and having signs posted asking drivers to slow down.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: JPP566
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the DoubleTree for a seminar I was taking at the Harvard Business School as it was the recommended hotel. The service was great, everyone was very helpful and friendly, from the main desk to the cleaning staff; however, the restaurant staff could use some work on their promptness.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. The lobby was elegant, there was a nice bar/restaurant in the hotel, and the room was great, overlooking the river. Plenty spacious. The bedroom was separated by the living room through a hallway. Location is not great. It costs $30.00 to park, and then more for the taxi. I suppose that's to be expected in Boston though. Warning: there is no free internet and no free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Boston - The Best Kept Secret - AWESOME & THEN SOME”
Reviews.Author: BostonFan_10
Reviews.Content: As Marketing Manager for a major corporation, I cover the New England territory and stay frequently in local Boston area Hilton hotels. I stayed at the Doubletree Boston in early April 2010 for business reasons - this was my first stay at this particular location. From the moment I entered the lobby and went to the front desk, I experienced the BEST (and I mean BEST) customer service that I have experienced in a long time. The front desk personnel were helpful and friendly, and went out of their way to make me feel welcome. Knowing that my family and I were planning to come back for a few days in late April to college hunt as we live in a nearby state, I cancelled reservations at a competitors hotel, and booked again at this location for a stay from April 22nd - 24th. Once again, the customer service was AMAZING!. Now, for the important part....the room was clean (not exceptional - could have been a bit better), however, it was cozy, the view was incredible, the beds were super comfortable, and everyone who helped us was AWESOME. DJ at the front desk - *****, Frederick the Concierge, *****, Delmy, Housekeeping,*****, Ty - Engineering/Maintenance, *****. This hotel is doing something very right and I applaud the General Manager of this property for giving some leeway to the staff to offer the little extras that make the guest feel important and welcome. In a day and age where we have too many choices, I can assure you, this location will be my first choice for both business and personal travel to Boston. Lastly, the breakfast buffet was excellent, and the shuttle to Boston was super convenient. I hope that the staff at this hotel continues to treat guests in the same manner, as this is noticed, and so important more than ever today!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location lacking.”
Reviews.Author: hmcrn2
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here for the Boston Marathon weekend. The hotel was nice, parking in a garage which was nice, and the rooms were quite roomy and comfortable. The only drawback is the location. It is right off of I-90 and Storrow Drive, so, it's good if you're driving everywhere, but the T station is a bit of a walk (about a mile). The shuttle is nice, but often not enough room for everyone, and is limited on Sundays. (last shuttle return is at 4pm) Since everything we wanted to do was near Copley Square, Boston Common, or the North End, we took a lot of cabs. A cab ride from Copley to the hotel was anywhere from $14 - $20 depending on traffic. I have to say however, that we were there on a very busy weekend. Harvard Square and Central Square were somewhat close (if you're driving), so we ate there a few times. Cool shops and restaurants. The concierge at the hotel was SUPER nice, and actually all of the staff were very friendly. As for Marathon Day, the hotel had shuttles for the runners to Boson Common quite early, and was no problem. Also shuttles all day back and forth for the rest to Copley Square and back. It was a good set up. We ate at least one breakfast, lunch and dinner at the hotel. All were good, and the service was good, but it is rather expensive. The bar/lounge area is comfortable, and the hot tub/pool area was great. Would i stay here again? Yes, if i'm driving around siteseeing around the Boston area. No, if I'm planning on doing things in town. Too many other hotels are nearer to the T, or within walking distance of the major areas in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but get the right room”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_and_Kate
Reviews.Content: Good, clean hotel. Not all rooms are suites, as we thought - our room was a bit small but fine for two people. If you are looking for a suite, make sure you reserve such. The shuttle helps to get around to popular attractions, but there is also a T stop about a 10 minute walk away. The hotel is next to the Charles - excellent biking path nearby. The pool is nice and clean, the gym is much above average for hotel facilities. The bar closes early however - and being far away from other hotels/ restaurants/ bars, make sure to find another place to get your last drink of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely make this a first choice of hotel next time I travel”
Reviews.Author: coll1079
Reviews.Content: I stayed only for one night with my 3 kids (11, 4 and 2), for a mini vacation, they enjoyed the hotel more than they enjoyed the museum of science and the zoo! Not only were the warm cookies awesome, but they could not get enough of the view from the 15th floor, and they especially LOVED the pool! The room itself was cozy, clean and did have it all, coffeemaker, good sized refrigerator and microwave. The bedroom being separated from the living room was nice so the kids could go to bed a little sooner than I did! As I said the view was fantastic! We had a full view of the river (at no additional charge) and the kids spend so much time in the windows! If I had to make any complaints, my main one would be that early in the morning, about 6 or so, the kids in the next room could not have been louder! They must have slammed their door to the room about 15 times and were just ridiculously LOUD! That and the fact that the sofa bed was not the most comfortable thing in the world, but they never are. I am thankful it was there! Overall, this was an excellent hotel in an excellent location. I will certainly be looking here first on my next trip to Boston or anywhere for that matter. I wish I could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eaglesfan04
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival you are greeted with a warm smile and a huge, warm cookie (a great start to my mini vacation). The 1-bedroom suite had everything you would expect, equipped with a refrigerator, microwave, gormet coffee, 2 flat scree tvs. The bed and linen were perfect as I had no trouble relaxing in the evening. The cafe and main restuarant were expensive, but gave generous portions. The business office with the computers were convenient because I was able to print out my boarding pass and skip the line at the airport. I didn't have a car, but the hotel has a shuttle that takes you to the popular areas around town. This was very convenient since this was my first time boston and didn't know my way around town. Overall, this is an excellent hotel with an amazing staff that works hard to meet your needs and expectations. One Suggestion - an airport shuttle is needed. One Gripe - $5.50 for a small bottle of shaving creme is a bit extreme.

Reviews.Title: “Boston bargain”
Reviews.Author: Conraveler
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated rooms. Clean. Very reasonably priced for a Boston hotel. On premises bar, restaurant and renowned jazz club. Noisy HVAC in my room. Note: Pets are allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: live_baby_live
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 nights, good price (about 80USD / night), bit far from T station but there was free shutle to several places (Copley, Boston Common etc) and it was always on time, so there was not problem to go anywhere. Front desk staffs were always nice, room was clean. Whole Foods marketwas within 10 min walk. I will stay here again when I have a chance to back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Old but fancy!”
Reviews.Author: qwrt
Reviews.Content: Nice location for business traveling! Great ham for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Worst beds ever”
Reviews.Author: gingersmomnj
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite nice. The lobby was nice and they sold Starbucks coffee in the morning. The pool was quite nice (but small). The shuttle bus to various locations worked out great. Even a taxi from most parts of town was not more than $10 back to the hotel. The beds were awful!!! My back hurt so bad I did not sleep the first night. We actually thought a cot might be more comfortable. I am going back to Boston and will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish MY bed and pillows were as comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: NorskeDecaturIL_USA_
Reviews.Content: I keep trying to find economical hotels for when my work takes me to Cambridge. Tried the Guest Suites last week with two colleagues for one night - late arrival (after dinner) and an 8a departure. One colleague was upgraded to a suite, and me and the other had non-suite rooms that adjoined another. My room (1616) was fine - but the bed and pillows were out of sight. I'd like to take them wherever I go. The other non-suite colleague had a problem with her heating (didn't work) - and the front desk wouldn't give her another room - they had one suite left... she had to wait about 45 mins for maintenance to fix things. Colleague with the suite heard noise from the jazz club until they closed at 10p. We were all really tired after taking an early morning flight from the Midwest. The breakfast buffet was good - made-to-order omelets and such. The normal price was $19 but we got a 50% discount because we were "Blue" members. The hotel is pretty close to the Mass turnpike (I think), so not so friendly for getting out for a walk. All in all it was OK - but we'll keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain - Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OopieB
Reviews.Content: Awesome guest suites. Spacious, clean, friendly staff - the concierge was amazing. Parking fee is overpriced, but the rooms definitely made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Location good if you know where you are, but friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MarijkeLondon
Reviews.Content: Had to take a cab to get to the hotel as it is a little tricky to find when you dont know the area. Upon arrival, however, the staff was extremely friendly and they have a chocolate chip cookie for every guest who is staying there for the first time which I thought was a nice touch. I had a room across from the elevator but it was not very noisy, especially when in the bedroom with the door closed. The room had a king size bed which was very comfortable and plenty of space for luggage. I cant comment on the breakfast as I didnt have any due to the high price. Internet is free in the business center but the computers are a little slow. No queues here though which is great. Upon checkout the staff kindly helped me with directions and provided me with a train schedule to my next destination. A shuttle leaves every hour to various stops nearby. Not a great location for inner-Boston things like the Freedom Trail as it is in the middle of Cambridge, but it is still doable as Harvard is only 20 mins walking away and Central Station even less from where you can take the red line into town. Not a lot of shopping nearby though. Now that I know the area, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: slce123
Reviews.Content: and Warm Cookies too. really nice breakfast buffet - can get a package to include it - made to order omelettes and pancakes. Dinner was awful - raw prime rib, cold soup - don;t eat in restaurant but breakfast very nice with great views. Ask for room with river view. Can get free parking in a package - ask for it. Front desk vewry nice. TVS in living room and bedroom didn;t work. Heat in bedroom didn;t work. But free coffee in room and Starbucks for charge in lobby. Very nice bed - comfy. Really in Cambridge - not really in Boston. Not a good location for Freedom Trail - have to take a car or bus to tourist things.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ccmontreal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Double Tree for Colombus Day week-end. sharing a suite while keeping our privacy was a big plus for us, I was travelling with my boyfriend and my aunt. The shuttle service is very convenient, eventhough it ends around 4pm on Sundays. The real downside of our stay was the noise in the room. Double Tree Guest Suites is home to one of the most famous jazz club of Boston. Our room was located on the 3rd floor and we heard the music until very late in the night, even in the bathroom. Asking for a higher level located room would probably do the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for family!!!”
Reviews.Author: KWRMaine
Reviews.Content: Just a great hotel for our family!!! Stayed at this DoubleTree while visiting some attractions in Boston. It was just first rate! The concierge desk was wonderful and the staff was so friendly and accomodating. The restaurant was a bit pricey, especially with children, and we ended up ordering in, after the front desk offered us some very helpful take out menus. The room was wonderful with the extra family room which worked out great for a couple of the kids, and we all loved the pool! A very clean facility, and very spacious and beautiful. The only downside was the long walk to the subway (it was winter) and we ended up getting a taxi to take us there....about a twenty dollar ride...better than walking in the cold. All in all, highly recommend, and we will most likely return as well!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: madcapgirl
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Warm cookie at check in? Oh hellz yeah! -A room? No, a suite! Complete with amazing view of the Charles, 2 flat screen TV's, fridge and microwave. Nice. -Very, very comfy bed. To the point where I physically had to make myself get up in the morning and I normally and up and about by 6:30am everyday. -Quiet and peaceful. No running, shrieking children or stumbling drunks out in the hall Cons: -kind of in an out of the way area. especially if you dont have a car. Nearest T stop is about a 15 minute walk away. Which wasnt a problem for us, but might be for some. -Free shuttle must be booked in advance and doesnt go to the airport. That kinda sucks! -there is a charge for WiFi. Not that we needed it but it is still stupid. -the lobby and the breakfast room might be the single most hideous decorating scheme for a hotel....ever. Seriously. Bright orange, chocolate brown, and sage green? Giant cut velvet fabrics in ghastly florally patterns? Um... excuse me while I go hurl. At least the rooms were toned down and of a more soothing palatte. -breakfast was INSANELY expensive for what you got (a $18 omelette...are you serious?) Normally we never eat in the hotel but we were short on time. And this is what the end result is. *sigh* All in all, a good place at a good price (got a pretty sweet deal on Priceline). If you cant spend $300 a night somewhere else, this Doubletree is a good place to save some money while spending time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Breaks Even”
Reviews.Author: cawaites
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room were very nice, but we experienced several problems during our stay. One: the AC unit was not functioning properly and was stuck on 74 degrees for 12 hours. Eventually, a repairman was sent to fix it very late in the evening. Also, the wireless internet connection was not good. We had to request a router, though we were still charged for the time that was not connected. The shuttle service is great. I don't feel the price accurately reflects the value of the hotel, however.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal in Boston”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer023
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days, partially because of previous Trip Advisor reviews. The reviews were correct: this is a good place to stay and the rates are better than most in this very expensive city. The location is far enough from the downtown area to be quiet but close enough to reach anywhere using a combination of the hotel's free shuttle bus and the T (subway). Our suite was spacious and well appointed, clean and comfortable. The hotel's restaurant and lounge were excellent too. We'll happily return here anytime we are again in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “We truly enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree...”
Reviews.Author: MissyY
Reviews.Content: Just got home from our first visit to Boston. We stayed at the Doubletree on 400 Soldiers Field Road (9/24/09 â€“ 9/25/09). We truly enjoyed our stay here. We got this hotel from priceline.com bid $80 per night after tax it came out to about $95 per night. Good price compared to just booking a room. We arrived at 12:30pm and they checked us right in (check in time is 3pm), also gave us 2 warm chocolate chip cookies. The room was clean & spacious 2 room king suite we had two flat screen TVâ€™s refrigerator, and a great view of the Charles River. They also have a jazz club, indoor pool, restaurant, bar, computers & printers available for use, and a fitness center. This hotel provided a free shuttle into the city depending where you were headed only a 5-15 min ride. These shuttles run from (I believe) 9am â€“ 9pm. (We saw a show in theater dist. that ran later then this and had to get a cab costs us $14 to get back to the hotel) Also on the day we were checking out they also let us use the shuttle.. no problem! (some places after you check out they donâ€™t even want to know ya) Great place to stay! No complaints! If I could change two things it would be have free parking (costs $30 a night to park â€¦but really you have to pay for parking everywhere in this city), and this hotel is a little out of the way not super far but just far enough you canâ€™t walk to from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't rent a car in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: JenFiz
Reviews.Content: There is no need to rent a car, weather permitting, if you are visiting Boston for a few days and staying at the DoubleTree. If you are trying to economize, you can take the train (the Charlie) from the Airport(take the blue line route) and get off at the Aquarium. There, you can get picked up by the DoubleTree shuttle. That's a savings of about $35 to $40 from a cab ride. Just be sure to call the hotel and arrange to be picked up. The shuttle runs from about 9am to 9pm on weekdays, a little less on the weekends. If you are imaginative and flexible, the DoubleTree's complimentary shuttle service can meet your transportation needs. They have four convenient shuttle stops: Harvard Square (there's a train station there, too), Copley Square (train station there), Boston Common and the Aquarium. Get a map, enlist the help of the concierges, tip the shuttle drivers, wear comfortable shoes and get ready to do a lot of walking!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay- Near Harvard and Boston Univ.”
Reviews.Author: BostonLuvr
Reviews.Content: I read other people's reviews and stayed here. Glad I did !! I loved the view from my 7th floor room- You cannot beat seeing the sun set on the Charles River and rise in the morning- Great photo op!! The Staff was fantastic- Restaurant a little pricey - but good- Music from the Jazz Club was Great( could hear it from the second floor Lounge. The Shuttle was great since Hotel a little out of the way from the " Tourist Places" For food I highly recommend walking across the bridge/overpass - Cambridge St. at the corner and eat at Whole Foods Market- they have a full fresh/ ready food area! YUM! Across from Whole Foods is a very nice park to stroll- The price of the room was great - My daughter just moved out there for college and I will definetely stay next time- only extra cost I came across with the internet cost for use in the room- No charge in the Business Center- If you are going to Visit Harvard or Boston University- I highly recommend this Hotel- You can also hook up this stay with your United Mileage Plus plan. ( HiltonHHonor program!!) Very clean and Laundry Area came in handy-

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - but beware of being overcharged”
Reviews.Author: slchan
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Boston so my family and I stay there for periodic visits. I booked through the hotel website and the "Park and Stay" rate was $159 which stipulated: "Stay with us 2 or more nights this summer and get discounted parking for $10 per night. The rate on this package includes the discounted parking." We were charged the rate PLUS $30 for three night's parking. When I called to complain, the man repeated that the charge would remain, that he was at the front desk ,and could he take down my home number and call back. He never phoned back. The next day, I spoke with a manager and he also could not understand how I could be confused by their wording. What part of INCLUDES THE DISCOUNTED PARKING did they not understand? He agreed and I have since been reimbursed. FYI the parking fee is now $30 per night. We've stayed there numerous times and the hotel housekeepers always do a fine job. The suites are spacious and allow our kids to sleep in the pullout sofabed while my husband and I have the bedroom. As for location, once you step out you pretty much have to cross what feels like highways. The fitness center has new equipment and our kids love the 3-5 feet deep pool, but you can go for a jog right outside along the Charles River on Memorial Drive. As for food outside of the hotel, walk across the bridge over the Charles which turns into River St. You will have crossed into Cambridge, MA and straight down on River St. there's a Whole Foods Supermarket. A 5-minute walk from the hotel and food that's alot better.

Reviews.Title: “Now charges for morning coffee”
Reviews.Author: goodrzy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Doubletree many times. When we stayed there in July 2009, the coffee setup in the lobby provided free morning coffee. At our stay on August 21 the coffee was Starbucks at a cost of over $1.00 per cup. ( We checked the Courtyard by Marriott across the river and the coffee was still free.) I'm afraid that the Doubletree has nickled and dimed us away from them. The front desk seemed short-staffed, too. They also charge for wi-fi in the roms. What was a welcoming atmosphere has been lost to making the quick buck.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if a little remote”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTraveller12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in July towards the end of our holiday. This was the second time that we had stayed in a Doubletrees hotel (the first being Times Square in New York) and I think that they are really spacious and good value, I am also sure that we will stay in their hotels in the future as we tend to go to America once a year. The central atrium to the hotel is nice with all the rooms spread out around the atrium. The rooms are large, clean and well furnished and we had a partial view of the river and all the rowers enjoying the good weather. The hotel is about 10 minutes drive out of the city centre and is oddly located - you almost feel that you are on a traffic island with roads on every side of you. Forget about driving into the city - the free shuttle bus is good although you do need to reserve seats as it gets full. We only ate in the hotel for breakfast and it was very good and as it is mostly a self service operation you can really fill your plate. The location is a little remote but we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if a bit off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: ladyluck523
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious enough and had a great view of the Charles River. The service was excellent. The concierge made great recommendations for nearby dining. The only negative things I have to say is that the location is a bit odd for sightseeing although the shuttle is convenient enough or you can walk to the T (try to avoid driving into downtown Boston if you can unless you want to pay an arm and a leg for parking). The other thing is the value for the room itself is good but then I had the feeling of being "nickel and dimed" to death. I had to pay extra for the parking, I had to pay for internet service, breakfast was not included (most of the suites hotel I stay at have a breakfast bar). That sort of thing. But all in all a very pleasant stay and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: kdkidd1
Reviews.Content: Traveled during the 4th of July. First of all, I found all staff members to be professional and friendly. The location was at times a challenge. The "T" was a leisurely 25-30 minute walk to the Central Station Red Line in Cambridge. We also utilized the free shuttle Doubletree had to offer as this was a busy weekend-- reservations for the shuttle strongly recommended- probably a good idea at anytime as they were booked solid on several ocassions. There are two grocery stores over the bridge-- cambridge side- for snacks and breakfast items as this hotel does not offer a free breakfast. Parking was a little pricey, our son rode his motorcycle to meet us and they charged $30 which seemed outrageous for a bike that wouldn't have taken a full parking spot. The bed was the serta perfect sleeper (very comfortable) and the shower strong and hot. We couldn't ask for anything more in hotel accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of fireworks”
Reviews.Author: mbelgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel to get a view of the fireworks. Only if you get a room that's facing the Charles and that's a little high up (we had room 707) can you see the fireworks. The view is off to the left side of the hotel so you can only have about 4 people sit on the ledge to watch them. The bedroom has a tv (in addition to another one in the living room) so you can see what's happening at the Esplanade at the same time. I'd rather do this than spend all day saving a good spot and still not be able to see the stage close up. The shuttle to Harvard Square, Copley and the Aquarium is great and convenient although over the 4th weekend, it was full most of the time. If you can get the shuttle, the T stop is around a 15 minute walk down River Street (not a very safe walk at night). If you're looking for food, Whole Foods is only a block away. There was a small frige in the room so we were able to get a few things for breakfast and lunch and splurged for dinner. When we go back to Boston, we will always stay at this hotel...the staff was friendly and really helpful, the place really clean, the pool was perfect. We didn't eat there so I can't rate the food/restaurant. Also, Sculler's Jazz club was closed when we were there. Other things we liked: business center with free access to the internet, free coffee downstairs, pull out queen sofa in the living room plus a king bed in the bedroom, awesome view of the Charles River, free shuttle service, close to Whole Foods.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: CoasterWarrior
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears to be a conversion of an Embassy Suites with its vertical atrium and actual two room suite layout. The rooms are roomy and nice. The hotel common areas were a bit better than expected, and the hotel has one of the best Jaz Clubs we have seen. Big names are booked in all the time. With the property's proximity to Harvard and MIT, it was clear they have quite a few related events, thus the quality of the common and group areas appears higher than most Double Tree hotels we have experienced. We were disappointed with the cleanliness of our bathroom. Too much dirt and dust and foreign hairs for our taste, but we always examine the bathrooms very closely when we evaluate a room. Another slight disappointment was the parking fee. We understand they need to pay for the nice garage structure, but we thought $25/day was a little high for a hotel that is not in town. It would certainly be even more at a downtown hotel, but $15/night would have been okay with us. While it may be possible to get a view that isn't great, our view of the river and MIT was outstanding. There were rowers every day, and that added to the feeling of the area. Given the property is a bit removed from downtown Boston and Harvard Square, the shuttle is a very nice service. It is regular, on demand and costs nothing. Many people may view the distance to downtown a real negative, but we found the property to be more quiet and peaceful than an urban hotel, and shuttle transportation offset the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Night away from home”
Reviews.Author: appleworm
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel but expensive Boston prices! The room was one of the most beautiful I have ever stayed in and had an incredible view of the Charles River, Harvard, and the city! The bed was very comfortable. The lobby is an open atrium and I was on the 11th floor. The hotel is lovely. I just think they could include breakfast in the price of the room. The restaurant was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: PegMcNeill
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a so-called "executive suite" an upgrade of 14 dollars a night for my daughter's graduation. we had a terrible experience. the air conditioning functions with a sensor so that it only works if it senses movement; it was 95 degrees while we were there. not only was the room broiling when we came back to it each afternoon, but the sensor in our suite, bedroom and front room, didn't sense motion while we were sleeping (big surprise) so it just turned off. We roasted -room was in high 80s both nights. Only way to get it to turn on was to get out of bed and wave hand in front of the sensor. even then ac only stayed on for about 30 minutes and then shut off again. when we complained the second night they sent an "engineer" who had no idea of what he was doing, kept talking about the sensor and saying it was fine, and then left leaving us to roast through yet another night. to add insult to injury the hotel charges $25 a night for parking and there is no place else to park nearby. Also on a busy corner with no nearby places to eat. Room was dated and shabby despite the so-called "upgrade". Save your money and go someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: flannelpants
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 4 times between Dec 2006 and July 2007 for business trips. This location was selected because of itâ€™s proximity to the company we were meeting with. It may otherwise be a bit off the beaten path. However, it is within walking distance of Harvard. I consider it within walking distance of the subway, but some people may not consider it walking distance since Iâ€™m sure it was a good mile away. There is definitely a Whole Foods grocery store and a drugstore within walking distance. I never had a car when I stayed here. I took a taxi to/from the airport. I took the subway if I wanted to go site seeing or to the North End for dinner. I heard others complain about the cost of parking at the hotel, so I imagine that it is high. The cookies on check-in are absolutely delicious! The restaurant breakfast buffet is okay. The drinks at the bar are way over priced. I recall a pub called something like River God within walking distance that had far better prices. Check with the Concierge as he was extremely helpful whenever we were looking for anything. High speed Internet is not free. I think it was $10 a day. The hotel rooms look like the actual photos. The room is suite style and nice. The wide, flat screen TV in the front room is really nice. Many rooms have good views. A previous reviewer mentioned a conference table in the front room. Usually those are given to business travelers by request. If you didnâ€™t want one, Iâ€™d say something about. A typical front room contains a love seat, chair, coffee table, and TV. Having been in quite a few rooms, I can tell you that a couple of them are starting to show some wear.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place conveniently located next to Harvard Business School”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: I stayed to this property for 2 nights while visiting HBS. While it's not close to the city centre, the highway provides easy access to downtown, and Cambridge is steps away. Nice view from the room, as you can see from the picture. I like the suite-thing, nice configuration with living room, fridge, microwave oven, etc. The restaurant is quite pricey, and I didn't try it, but the quality seemed to be good. Even though arrived at 9 am, I was given a room without problems, which is quite nice after a long overnight flight! The hotel boasts a gym (nicely equipped), an indoor pool with whirpool and a sauna. All in all, I would stay here again if in Boston and if I got a good price. But do not stay here if you don't have a car!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: sixteencmg
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline and I was initially really irritated to be booked at a Doubletree Guest Suites, which I don't think fit the bill of 3.5 "upscale deluxe" or however Priceline described the option. The hotel is oddly located if you are a "walking tourist," it's right off the highway and a boring 1 mile walk to the subway. We did have a beautiful view of the Charles River, but our room was really weird. We had a suite, but the main room had nothing but a HUGE conference table. So I'm not sure we really got a good deal, since over half of the suite was completely unusable unless we wanted to re-enact the final scenes from "The Apprentice." However, the room was really clean and everyone at the hotel was really nice. If you are traveling with a family or don't like to eat out. It's nice to have a fridge in the room and there is a Whole Foods just across the River Bridge. We were there during the marathon and it appeared that the hotel was really well organized to help participants and their families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: DVadala
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for one night when our favorite team (the Baltimore Orioles) was in town to play the Red Sox. I booked a one bedroom suite with a pullout sofa. We arrived around 11 AM, but the room wasn't ready due to the fact that they were sold out the night before. I totally understand this, as their normal checkin time is 3 PM. The Front Office Manager (Joe) couldn't have been nicer in storing our luggage, and giving us any tour information that we requested. They allowed us to use their shuttle to get to the subway station even though we had not checked in. The only drawback to this property was that it was about a 15 minute walk from the subway, but their shuttle service was great. We returned to the hotel around 2 PM and the room was ready. When we got into the room it was great. There was a totally separate bedroom for my sister, and the pullout sofa for me in the living room was great. We were planning to eat breakfast in the hotel restaurant the next morning before heading to the airport to fly home, but they said that breakfast was $20 per person! This is a very upscale property and a great value, but I might recommend they look at their pricing for breakfast in their future.

Reviews.Title: “Served our purposes”
Reviews.Author: EdgeofExistence
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to this hotel as home-base, from where we could explore Cambridge and Boston during her birthday weekend. I did get a good price on Priceline, and since budgetary concerns were more important to us than a fancy hotel, I suppose it did serve our purposes. The hotel and the room were immaculately clean, and the room itself was ginormous (a big living room, big bathroom, and big bedroom - all separate!). On the flip side, I did find the hotel to be lacking some personality, somewhat stripped of any major decor, and in a really odd location....we got off the freeway and were right at the hotel, which would sound ideal, but in actuality we had to maneuver our car into the hotel's driveway despite being surrounded by other drivers going a billion miles an hour. Once we were in the hotel, however, we found it to be relaxing and quiet, with comfortable bedding, and a fairly receptive staff. We did use the shuttle service, which is wonderful and convenient. On the other hand, it runs on a fixed schedule, so we found ourselves having to plan around the shuttle schedule (still convenient, but important for other guests to be aware of). I did feel that it was worth the money - however, in contrast, I have had the wonderful experience of staying in another hotel in the heart of Boston that was bursting with personality and staff members who were eager to help. Would I stay here again? Yes, but only if I got a good bargain again.

Reviews.Title: “AwfulLocation-Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTales
Reviews.Content: Outrageous parking fee; surly doorman; helpful concierge. We asked for a room away from the elevator, don't you know the room was right at the elevator. Our daughter heard it ding all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Suites after renovations”
Reviews.Author: OldNew-Englander
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Doubletree Suites Boston fairly often. In my most recent review I alluded to the encroaching ravages of age in the hotel. (In me too, but that is another matter!) The hotel has been refurbished and refreshed: microwaves have been added and furnishings updated. The location is still a matter of taste. It is 0.9 miles to the nearest T stop at Central Square, but I do not mind the walk. They still charge for on-site parking, which seems incredibly petty. They still charge for private internet, but the free public internet does reach virtually all of the rooms, and is adequate as long as you are not downloading files, etc. Once you cut through some of the penurious policies of the hotel, it is clean and spacious with a pleasant staff and comfortable suites that are often quite affordable by Boston standards. It is helpful if you like to walk!

Reviews.Title: “Weird design, noisy, food to avoid.”
Reviews.Author: Ruperto
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree has a strange design, rooms are accessed from a huge central open space from the lobby to the top of the hotel...trouble is this big atrium echoes with noise including a squeaky escalator. There is also lots of traffic noise from the freeway intersection that surrounds much of the hotel (railway yards on the other side...only one side looks out over the river). The suites do have two separate rooms but no kitchen. Wireless internet costs $10 / day. We had twin beds that were terrible...very poor mattresses. The restaurant in the hotel has a nice location looking out over the river, but the food is poor (baked potato was rotten inside). Great cocktails so, and a lively jazz club next door. Parking is expensive $25/night.

Reviews.Title: “Where the guest is always wrong--"It's our policy"”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter80424
Reviews.Content: I can't count the number of times I heard the phrase "Its our policy." as thought that was a sufficient explaination for overcharging, mischarging or providing rude service. It seems it is their policy to have housekeeping knock on you door at 7:30am on Saturday, and at 15 minute intervals until sleep is no longer possible. There were no "do not distrub" door hangers, and a handmade one was ignored. It is their policy to charge $6 for a 12 second wrong-number that their system misdirected to an out-of-state site. It is their policy to charge their guest for a minimum of $25 for a full day of parking while non-guests who use the parking structure for 8 hours can pay only $10. When I complained about the parking fee, the first response of the duty manager was an attemp to intimidate by telling me that they had my license number and could find my room number, and that I was under video surveillance . (The use of video surveillance on the property is not disclosed as required by courtesy and law.) The implication was that they would charge my credit card without my consent, an act of fraud. In this instance, after an unpleasnt exchange with the Duty Manager she allowed me to pay the hourly rate, but offered no apology for the attempt to overcharge. It is no fun to stay at a place where corporate convienience and self-serving policy take precedence over hospitality. I do not intend to do so again

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Newenglandhome
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Priceline for $81.00 a night! The bonus here is the FREE SHUTTLE! Service to Boston Common/Copley Square/Harvard Square/Aquarium. This eliminates the need for the T. Our view overlooked the Charles River directly below and Harvard/MIT. Please note this is not a hotel within walking distance of anything. Take the Shuttle! Rooms were spotless and spacious. Refrig, microwave nice additions. We had a broken remote for the TV and had a replacement in less than 5 minutes!! SUPERIOR SERVICE!! Scullers Jazz Club located within the hotel as well. Parking an additional $25.00 per day. You can keep you vehicle in their lot til 4:30pm the next day without any extra fee as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for families and business”
Reviews.Author: gulig
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the double tree through Priceline and the second night using rewards. Since we have two young girls, the size of the room was a big plus. The service was great, everyone was friendly and professional. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business...and I'll come back with my wife”
Reviews.Author: cjbutton
Reviews.Content: I came for business, and this hotel handled my needs masterfully. We were greeted at the door, and all of the arrangements were handled in an efficient and in very friendly manner. I'll be returning to Boston for a personal visit with my wife and this is where we'll stay. My room had a beautiful view of the rowers on the river at sunrise - what a beautiful way to start the day. My room was large, comfortable and quiet and for the evening, there was a great lounge to relax and unwind in downstairs. The wireless worked great, and I was easily able to print my boarding passes at the business center. I'll definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: webstermom
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights and three days at the Doubletree Guest Suites in Boston recently and wish we could have stayed longer! Our family of four spread out in the roomy suite, which was equipped with flat screen TVs, a small fridge, microwave and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The staff was so personable, polite, pleasant and professional that nothing we did -- like lock ourselves out of the room right after checking in; call down for a forgotten toothbrush, and make last-minute reservations for a shuttle ride to Harvard Square -- seemed to phase any of them. After the first night, they even greeted us by name (maybe they felt bad about our mishaps). We managed to fit in so much more sightseeing and shopping thanks to the hotel's fabulous location, and convenient (free!) shuttle service to both downtown Boston and Harvard Square. After my husband and oldest son left to see the Celtics play in the Boston Garden, my younger son and I decided to go on a "date" for hot chocolate in Harvard Square. Even though we only had to wait a few minutes for the shuttle, the front desk clerk was sweet enough to give my 7-year-old a fresh-from-the-oven chocolate chip cookie to enjoy in the beautiful, boutique-y lobby, which looks like it's recently been updated, as do the two restaurants. Several of us enjoyed an evening swim in the toasty indoor pool and the buffet breakfast with made-to-order omelets and waffles was worth every penny. Hope to catch a show at Scullers Jazz Club next time we visit the hotel since there will definitely be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: BizRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for 4-nights and it was pleasant, if unremarkable. Location was just okay. I was glad to have a room with a view of the city and not what looked to be a chemical plant next door. Once in the hotel, the atmosphere was good. Facility was clean and pretty quiet. I do find hotels with large windows facing the common interior hallway/corridor to be bothersome since you can't really enjoy sitting in the living area with natural light unless you want to look at all the other people walking around inside the hotel. The rooms are where the hotel excels. Rooms are large, 2-room suites with comfortable sofa and chair in the living area. Pantry area has a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker. HVAC unit was pretty loud, so if you activate the cooling or heating, expect to hear it kick on and off. Bathroom was adequate and typical of most hotels. Amenities include Neutrogena brand shampoo, conditioner and hand lotion along with bar soap. Bedroom was comfortable. Closet door is a folding/accordion type which was a little noisy. Luckily, I don't think anyone was in the adjacent room to be disturbed by my late night or early morning rituals. Adequate desk space in the bedroom area for working. Wireless laptop signal was very good, and consistent. Room service food was just okay. Prices were fair, with the usual add ons for room service (delivery/tip). The continental breakfast is overpriced for what you receive (2 pastries, coffee and juice), when for a couple of dollars more you can order the American Breakfast (2 eggs, 2 sausage/bacon, potatoes, toast, coffee, juice). Go for the American Breakfast. Location isn't all that close to anything site-seeing worthy. Be prepared to walk or find other transportation for tourist destinations.

Reviews.Title: “First-Rate Service”
Reviews.Author: NIKOKA
Reviews.Content: I frequently pass through Boston and stay at this Doubletree every time. The service is consistently excellent, the staff always welcoming and professional. The recent renovations in the lobby, the restaurant and the fitness center were executed in a commendable fashion and resulted in a superior lodging experience. Staying at this property always makes my business travel much more pleasurable, and my family always looks forward to our leisure stays here as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Crankypants
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Priceline, it's a little off the beaten track, but for a few nights its great. There is a free shuttle to and from various places around the city. The rooms are great, plenty of room, after New York it's a mansion! The staff are friendly and helpful. Erica on the front desk went out of her way to find us some information about a few sights we wanted to see in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A Place for Our Reunion”
Reviews.Author: jiggs8
Reviews.Content: For the past five years, my college girlfriends and I have stayed at the Doubletree the weekend after Thanksgiving. It is our annual trek to Boston and we wouldn't go anywhere else. The accomodations are great...very clean and comfy. The staff are polite and most helpful and the food is great. The location is terrific as it's a quick taxi ride to Boston and a stone's throw to Harvard Square. I give the Doubletree excellent marks and will continue to come back for our reunions for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “spacious room, but a little off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: jesssince83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, at a great rate of $120/night thanks to Priceline. The hotel is a little off the beaten path - in a no-man's land between Boston and Cambridge. The hotel and the staff, however, make up for the location's shortcomings. A complimentary shuttle is available, though we just walked to the Cambridge T stop or took cabs. The room itself was wonderful. The first room had a dining room table, a sofa and a club chair, and a large flat-screen tv. The walkway to the bedroom had a mini-fridge and coffee pot. Bedroom had a great view of the Charles River.

Reviews.Title: “Just Lovely”
Reviews.Author: VTTraveler57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove from Vermont to see a Red Sox game, and spent one night at the Doubletree Guest Suites. We booked the room on Priceline and were pleased at getting such a good rate. When we arrived at the hotel and went up to our room, we found a beautiful 2-room suite with TWIN BEDS in the bedroom. Priceline had given us no indication of this, of course. Well, this wasn't what we had in mind. I called the front desk, and a very pleasant young man listened to my story. He could not have been more helpful. "I've seen that with Priceline reservations, people don't know what type of room they're bidding on. You'll want a different room, of course... let me see what I can find for you... I have a room with a king bed on the 6th floor. Would that be all right?" Goodness, yes, I replied; what will the extra charge be? "Oh, no extra charge, ma'am, we're happy to accommodate you." Rarely do I see this level of service when I travel. What a pleasure! The hotel itself is beautiful, with a center atrium, 14 floors, glass elevators... beautiful views from the room of rowers sculling on the Charles River in the morning. The hotel's shuttle brought us to within a 15-minute walk of Fenway Park, which was very helpful. The suite itself was roomy, spotless, with plenty of room to sleep, work, relax, snack. Big screen TV in living area, second TV in bedroom. Mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker were very welcome. My ONLY quibble with this hotel, and many others -- in this day and internet age, it's silly to charge ($10/day?) for high-speed internet. It would be like charging for telephone or TV 30 years ago. Lesser hotels all over the country offer internet/WiFi for free; it's time for the Doubletree (and the Boston Four Seasons, for heaven's sake) to do the same. In any case, this hotel would make a wonderful base from which to explore Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep ever!”
Reviews.Author: bear2Maine
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the Doubletree guest suites in Boston. Great place! highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Boston. The location is perfectly located just off the Mass Pike for easy access with the Charles River on the other side. Enjoyed watching the scullers from my rooms large window overlooking the river. The hotel looks as though it has been completely renovated. Everything is very modern and up to date from furnishings to art to very elegant glass elevators. I had dinner both nights in the bar area where they offered a full menu and a comfortable place to watch the game. I highly recommend the steak and definitely don't leave without trying the calamari. It's the best I have ever had! Finished watching the game on the new flat screen TV in HD back at the room. Rarely do I sleep threw the night but those two night I did. Very comfortable bed with some sort of pillowing under the sheets. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “The Doubletree is great!”
Reviews.Author: hartfordtraveler5
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is in a fabulous location and is VERY easy to get to from the Mass Pike. It is within walking distance to much of Boston. The rooms are clean and spacious with a great view of the Charles River. When traveling with my family it is great to have a suite as we all fit in very nicely. I appreciate the cleanliness of the rooms and the curteous staff, but my kids would tell you the best thing are the warm chocolate chip cookies you get when first checking in!

Reviews.Title: “Double Tree: What a versitle property: Three amazing experiences!”
Reviews.Author: timpops
Reviews.Content: I am a meeting planner from NY and recently held three seperate events at the Double Tree Cambridge: A meeting for 20, a bachelor party for 25 and a conference with over 60! All functions went splendidly well and I would recommend the hotel to anyone: familys, large groups and even Bachelor Parties. The Double Tree Cambridge, (located in Cambridge obviousely hence the name) and has beautiful views of Harvard and the Charles River. I saw a review where someone wrote the property was isolated- I have no idea why that was written because the hotel is just across the small bridge from shops and restaurants and even provides a free shuttle service to/from atttractions across the city. It seems centrally located to me. Oh, and btw- its an 8 minute ride to Logan airport (do not stay at the airport, YIKES). The property is beautifully maintained and was recently renovated with a modern feel. On the top floor of the hotel are bi-level suites; the space and the views are incredible. The room features floor to ceiling windows (20 feet high) with 2 bathrooms, a kitchen and a loft bedroom. How can you go wrong. The hotel also has other great features: Free business center, full-service restaurant and seperate bar, the world famous Schullers Jazz Club and large meetings spaces for weddings, family reunions and large conferences. The hotel can also host small meeting like mine (15 people) where you are given the same attention as a conference of 200. I would highly recommend this property to anyone- for a weekend getaway or a week long event like mine. The Double Tree became my home away from home and I honestly cannot wait to return for another visiting in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: DavidVermont
Reviews.Content: Love staying at the Doubletree when we come down with the family, perfect in so many ways. It's just off the highway and so easy to find, and we can park right at the hotel so easy to get our bags in and out and access the car if we need to use it. Mostly we use the free shuttle buses or taxi if we need to. The location next to the river is incredible for the views and a bit of morning excercise and the staff is so freindly and helpful. Everyone loves the breakfast buffet, the cookies at checkin, the adjoining rooms with mini fridge and sink, and wireless. On several occasions we have left the kids in the room with a movie after dinner out and my wife and I were able to catch a jazz show downstairs. Other times when we were too tired to go out we all had dinner at the hotel restaurant which was surprisingly good, even when we tried room service. As anyone with a family knows, easy is the key word, and the Doubletree certainly makes it easy.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't pay me to stay at Doubletree, Allston”
Reviews.Author: bearmomSeattle
Reviews.Content: One morning we saw a continental breakfast (which seems to be common at most places we've stayed the last few years) set up in the common area where they send you to get internet connectivity. We saw several other guests grab a bite and continue on their way, so figured we had time for a bagel. Numerous hotel staff passed by and said nothing. Finally one little guy came up to us yelling "This is set up for a meeting group, we don't want to see you here! GO! Put down the rest of the bagel and LEAVE!" We had seen no group, only other hotel guests, and were so embarrassed, and asked if we could just pay for the bagels as it was a misunderstanding, and he just kept yelling "you go!" At first we were just embarrassed by the misunderstanding, but after seeing how believably rude the employee was, we got angrier and angrier. They should have put up a sign or somehow indicated it was for a specific group, since many hotel guests were making the same mistake, but only we we were yelled at "you need to leave!" over and over. It was humiliating, and all over a stupid bagel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for traveling with small kids!”
Reviews.Author: Patsje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 14 months old son. The hotel has fabulous spacious suites. OK, itâ€™s not downtown or Beacon Hill, but they have a shuttle bus going there or you can take the subway (red line). Central Square Station is a fifteen minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family”
Reviews.Author: SasquatchPasayten
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Doubletree every time we go to Boston. I love to get up in the morning and run alongside the Charles and the rowers, which we can see from the rooms. The kids like the warm cookies at check-in. (Okay, we like them too). The newly renovated rooms are perfect for a family, the beds are comfortable, and the linens nice. Although the hotel is a quick ride from the airport, and the shuttle service to downtown locations is very conveniet, it is a particularly good place to stay with a car because of the easy parking at the hotel garage. (Note: the hotel is bound by busy arterials, but a pleasant walk along the river on the Cambridge side puts you in the pedestrian-friendly vicinity of Harvard Square). We have had nothing but good experiences at the Doubletree with its friendly staff. The concierge always has great restaurant recommendations and has dinner reservations ready for us when we arrive. In the morning we like to have a hearty breakfast at the hotel, and then we are off. We enjoy the family-friendly and pet-friendly feel of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree: Good But A Little Isolated”
Reviews.Author: SFGuy35
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree Boston (Allston) in September, 2008, and found it to be a well-kept, well-equipped facility, especially for a Hotwire rate of under $100. However, its isolation makes it a challenge. The hotel itself was nicer than I expected, with a renovated lobby and a respected local jazz club in the atrium. The small gym was surprisingly well-equipped and just down the hall were two coin-operated washers and dryers--a great idea. Great little salt-water pool and hot tub. Room service menu was extensive and available until 3 am, and the breakfast buffet, while a little pricey at $17, was good. The Hotwire rate is pretty good for expensive Boston, but Hotwire customers may be a little surprised with what they get -- my room, while well-appointed, was the smallest one on the floor, barely half the size of the other "suite" style rooms. Doubletree are being a little sneaky, giving Hotwire customers the "runts" of the litter. Thankfully it didn't matter to me as a single traveler, but a couple might find it a bit cramped. While the hotel's location next to the Charles River across from Cambridge makes for lovely views of the river (if you're lucky), it's extremely isolated. Across the river you'll find a Whole Foods and a Rite Aid, and jogging/biking trails line the river, but car-free travelers will have to buck up and learn the bus route to the Red Line, because there is nothing, and I mean nothing, within walking distance, other than some sort of train depot and a Harvard lab building, and lots of multi-lane roads. However, hotels in Boston are crazy expensive, and a budget traveler looking for amenities over location can't do much better -- anything in the price range will be a sketchy B&B or something.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: pepsiNy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the past few years, and its consistantly outstanding. They recently renovated and now its even more outstanding. The lobby feels like a boutique hotel. The restaurant looks amazing..and as usual the food and the service are wonderful. The staff is excellent. Everyone is friendly and professional, always polite and looking to assist the guests. I ocassionally bring my children to the hotel and they too are always very happy with our stays...additionally the staff goes out of their way to make the kids feel welcome, and special. I highly recommend this hotel to both the busniess and leisure traveler. Its rare that a hotel can serve both well, but this Doubletree really does "double duty"! Go and stay, you will NOT be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Love the view”
Reviews.Author: jolijowino
Reviews.Content: Had recent three-night stay for Boston sight-seeing and a Red Sox game. Enjoyed the view of Cambridge and Charles River. A hearty breakfast in the am and off for the day -- parking appreciated! The pool was great, particularly for the kids after a day of walking. We didn't see a show at Sculler's (Jazz Club in hotel), but have done so on a previous visit - Harry Connick Jr. The lobby was spacious and inviting, ample space to relax; restaurants and bar good food and drink. Rooms large, beds VERY comfortable, TV, internet, etc. Staff friendly -- complimentary cookies!! Love the hotel! Highly recommend it for families visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our purpose.”
Reviews.Author: EssexBetty64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Suites for three nights Friday to Monday. As a family of four (2 teenages 17 and 14) the suite was perfect. My husband and I slept on the pull out sofa which was very comfortable and kingsize. American hotels obviously don't expect you to eat in the room though they supply fridge but I did know this and took my own plastic plates for cereals etc but had to plead for cutlery. The hotel is bit far from the tourist drag but I knew this after reading other reviews. We got taxis and spent about Â£100 over the weekend but this included our returned trip to the airport. I cannot fault this hotel for cleanliness and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: debs0712
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Boston to see a jazz show at Sculler's Jazz Club. The jazz club is located in this hotel so we decided to stay there. We arrived around 1pm and our room was not ready but they held our luggage and we had lunch in the restaurant. The suite was on the 8th floor and was very well laid out and we enjoyed it. There is a separate bedroom and living/dining room and they are separated by the bathroom and fridge/microwave area. All the suites look out on to the center atrium area and it is a bit noisy but not enough to disturb your sleep. The jazz shows were excellent and we bought the dinner and show package for one of the shows and it was a good value. It was a 3 course meal with an excellent choice for dinner and then great seats for the show.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Boston is closer to Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: Sunkissed_Jan
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, across the river from Cambridge. The concierge staff was very enthusiastic about making dinner recommendations and reservations for us during Restaurant Week and answering all our direction questions, even when we called from off site. On the other hand, several of the front desk personnel were less than informative and lacked a hospitable attitude. The location is isolated, however, right next to Route 90. You must take the free quick hotel shuttles to the set locations, Aquarium, Copley Square, Harvard Square; walk about a mile to the T, take a taxi or drive into Boston. We enjoyed excellent weather and were good walkers, but it is a factor for future visits. Despite the free chocolate chip cookies on check in, I did feel nickel and dimed, parking was $25/day, $10/day in room internet, $5 each Showtime program. My teenage son refused to buy soda there, it was $1.50. We did not have breakfast or any meals there, again due to the prices, $16.00 for a hot breakfast buffet. We did fine stocking up at the Whole Foods and Trader Joe's across the bridge, using the in room refrigerator and microwave. Excellent coffees and teas were supplied (free). We requested and received a river view room. The bedroom had 2 twin beds, which was okay. The living room couch opened to a fairly comfortable double bed. The decor was excellent, although I could have used a mirror in the bedroom. The HDTV in the living room had a GameBoy controller. The room was very clean, except near the refrigerator. The pool was on the small side, but enjoyed by the young set. The hot tub was fine. Apparently the sauna has not worked for a long time, but it is still on the hotel web site. For the $185/nite I paid (AAA rate) plus parking, plus tax, I felt the hotel was market-appropriate. I needed a suite layout and chose this hotel, despite the location, because of the shuttle and did not mind the proximity to Cambridge. Check out the shuttle schedule- it does not make its hourly runs at 4 or 5 in the afternoon and stops fairly early in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and Jazz Club”
Reviews.Author: Droopydrawrs52
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the above.Our room was very large with a bedroom and lounge.It would of slept 4 people .The views over the River Charles were wonderful . The staff first rate and helpful for such a large hotel. Scullers jazz club was located in the hotel and is a great place to hear live jazz at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Very mixed review”
Reviews.Author: mooshai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in July 2008. Very mixed view. The rooms are great, and if you have one with a river view, even better. But the common areas are dated, worn, and in need of upgrading. On-site lounge, allegedly voted "Boston's best jazz club," was shut down before 11;30 at night. Also, the neighborhood is horrible. You are right off the highway, but there is no area to walk around in. Bordered on the expressway on one side, railroad tracks on another, an intersection, and an industrial park. So, you can't walk around outside the perimeter fence. The property definitely serves a purpose, but you could probably do better. Good value, sure, but I'm not itching to return.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable Service”
Reviews.Author: Button75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Boston to help our son get settled prior to starting his graduate program at Harvard, and we stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites from July 21 through 25. We selected this property because of its relative proximity to Harvard taking into consideration what other posters on this site have cited about its isolation. We thought that the hotelâ€™s shuttle to/from Harvard Square would offset this disadvantage. Certainly one of the hotelâ€™s assets is its view of the Charles River.
