Ours was a bi-level suite on the top floor facing the river. We never tired of watching the sculls glide past. This positive, however, could not possibly overcome the host of negatives we encountered with service. It began the moment we arrived with the frosty reception at the front desk. We should have known what was to come when we were greeted more as interlopers than guests. Other dealings with the front desk during our stay were equally borderline rude. Our breakfasts, though, are the source of the biggest horror stories. The restaurant staff enjoys engaging guests, that is, if you consider arguing a form of engagement. The first morning I went to the buffet to order an omelet. After looking at the list of possible ingredients I request a spinach omelet. The cook says he canâ€™t make one. I point to the list and tell him that it says he can. He argues that Iâ€™m wrong so I walk away sans omelet. Day 2 arrives and I know omelets are a lost cause so I decide they canâ€™t mess up cereal. I go to the buffet for a box of cereal, but there are no bowls. The hostess is the only staffer I can find so I inform her of my need. She tells me the bowls are on the left-hand side of the buffet. I explain thatâ€™s where I looked, and there are no bowls there. She counters that I did not look hard enough. In a stern tone I said I need a bowl. With a scowl she goes into the back returning with six bowls. What was priceless was her look of utter surprise when she got to the buffet and realized there actually were no bowls. One other thing about breakfast, donâ€™t expect to get more than one cup of coffee. On Day 1 we were promptly poured a cup when we sat down for breakfast. When we got up from the table 30 minutes later that was still the only cup of coffee we received. Day 2 was even more galling. We had the same waiter as Day 1 (short guy with white hair) so our expectations were tempered when we sat down and got our first cup. After 30 minutes the waiter comes up to our table with a pot, peers down at our empty cups then turns on his heels walking away with the pot. What happened on Day 3? We took a cab to Cambridge for breakfast. Apparently the acute coffee shortage has not struck there allowing us to enjoy several refills. There were other missteps in service, such as the ridiculous shuttle service to Harvard Square, that made this hotel an expensively miserable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but they need to change the name to Doubletree Allston/Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: Melwyjak
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my family of 4, 2 adults, 2 kids under 10 because of the great price and so we could park our car with in and out privileges (for $25 a day). We used to live in Boston so we weren't doing the tourist thing but visiting friends in the area or we would not have chosen this hotel. In my opinion, Boston is best experienced on foot and this hotel is outside of town and walking is dangerous. If you are in need of a suite and willing to take a shuttle or cab to town, the hotel is perfect. We drove up and nobody came out to help with our bags. We had to get one of the trolley things and unpack ourselves and maneuver the thing around. They didn't explain which key was needed to get in the parking garage so we had to go back in and ask the front desk. I heard someone with the same problem when we checked out - they need to tell people. We had two twin beds in our suite. Who has twin beds? We made it work but it was kind of odd. There's a flat-screen HDTV in the living room with a comfy couch, chair, glass coffee table and table with 3 chairs. There's a frig and coffee for 2 single cups in between the living and bedroom areas. The maid took our dirty glasses and did not replace them. I noticed food crumbs in the hallway outside of door that we never vacuumed while we were there. The bathroom was adequate. I noticed a little mildew around the tile. Why don't hotels use Clorox pens is all I can ask. They work miracles. The bedding and furnishings were attractive. We had a problem with the bedroom door not closing and decided to live with it versus moving all of our stuff late at night. They gave us a free movie for our trouble. The bedroom had a nice view of the Charles River and the Boston skyline. The interior room has no view. We paid $9.95 per 24 hours for wireless. We were perfectly comfortable - Doubletrees are nice if you have kids and like to spread out. The rooms were quiet. My husband has a sweet tooth and loved the cookies. The kids loved the room service pizza for Pizzaria Uno. All and all, I don't really have any complaints besides the twin beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, many conveniences”
Reviews.Author: toutingstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites from July 6 to July 12. The hotel is nice and clean. The suites are roomy with a fridge and a microwave (our fridge even had a little freezer although the room next door did not have the freezer in their fridge). The pullout couch was actually very comfortable. It's not the kind where you can feel the springs of the bed but it looked like the mattress was three sections of firm foam which folded over into the couch. There was even a little round table with chairs which was nice as we had breakfast in our suite a few of the mornings. There is the cutest little 2 cup Wolfgang Puck coffee maker which made really nice coffee or if you prefer, there is coffee down in the lobby each morning. There's a nice flat screen TV in the living room area and a regular TV in the bedroom. The restaurant, the Green Room, had really good food. We asked for towels twice and the towels arrived at our door within minutes. We had a gorgeous view of the river on the 7th floor. The pool was adequate with large pool towels. Parking is in a covered indoor lot so your car is not scorching hot when you get in. In terms of location, it is really not near to any attractions but really not far from any either. We took the shuttle to the Aquarium one day and it picked us up in the afternoon no problems. We drove to the Children's Museum and into Cambridge and the Museum of Science and it was not too far at all. The thing is that the hotel is close to the highway so if you stay away from peak hours, these attractions are only 20 minutes away. There is a Whole Foods across the bridge so you can easily buy fresh fruits and breakfast stuff for quick and easy breakfasts in the morning. Whole Foods is expensive but alot cheaper than doing the breakfast buffet downstairs every morning (you can even buy breakfast foods by the pound in the prepared meals section). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of Charles River, a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: fercho29
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. It has a very impressive indoor courtyard with all the corridors around. The views are spectacular, specially if you get a room looking to the Charles River and Downtown Boston. The suites are very comfortable. they have a nice living area with a table for four person, a couch and a lounge chair, and a very nice plasma TV. The kitchen is in the corridor to the bedroom. it has a small refrigerator and a microwave, Every day they replace the stock of tea, coffee and coffee condiments. There is a coffee maker to brew your coffee every day. The bedroom in my case had two beds and a nice desk to work with my computer while enjoying the great views. The only problem with this hotel is the shuttle service: it is completely unreliable. the most of the times I waited in the pick up stop and it never came, or i got ONE minute late to the lobby and it has already departed (although we needed to make the reservation, so they knew that somebody was missing). Other times, in the contrary, we waited ten minutes on the bus and it didn't departed. They change the routes constantly, they had old brochures with outdated schedules, etc. Be ready to spend money in taxis, or to walk a lot, because there are no buses nearby and the subway station is a good 15 minutes walk. The pro of this: walking to Harvard along the Charles River is exquisite (although it will take you more than 30 minutes)

Reviews.Title: “Big Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Woodstock98
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this hotel. (3 kids ages 12, 13 and 15) True, it is out of the way, but the shuttle service got us everywhere we wanted to go. It was about a 15 minute walk along the river to get to Harvard, and about a 15 minutes walk down the street to the T stop for Central Square. There is a Whole Foods 2 blocks away and we bought our breakfast foods there. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the shuttle service was terrific. We would come home from a day of touring, then hop on the shuttle to go downtown to eat. It was always on time, but you do have to make reservations for it, so plan accordingly. The rooms were spacious and the beds very comfortable. It was a great value for the price, especially in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy atrium, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: dressyd
Reviews.Content: As Hilton Honor members, we stayed on the 15th floor (16 floors in all). The suites have 2 tvs (a tube tv in the bedroom and a flat screen tv in the living room). The bedroom was quiet. If you plan on having on any guests sleep on the sofa bed in the living room, plan to bring some earplugs. You can hear doors slamming and the noise from the atrium. You can also hear guests from the next door room. While we were there, the hotel was replacing the carpeting and drapery in the the rooms so we heard hammering before 8 am. When we left for the breakfast buffet ($12 pp), one of the construction workers asked us if he can go in the room to do some work. Of course, we answered no. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet in one of the restaurants, which consisted of made-to-order omelettes, waffles, pancakes, fresh fruit, bagels, pastries, bacon, sausage, potatoes, cereal, oatmeal, freshly-squeezed orange, juice, pop, coffee and milk. Our room had a nice view of the river. The hair dryer in the bathroom did not work, so we just grabbed another one from one of the rooms that was being renovated. We had to call housekeeping to bring toilet paper since we ran out. The hotel has a swimming pool and good-sized exercise facilities. The location was okay. It was a 20 min. walk from the Central stop (Red LIne train). You can also take the 64 bus, which stops across the street from the hotel, but it runs every 30 min. to 1 hour depending on the time of the day. Make sure you arrive early to take the free hotel shuttle. You are supposed to make reservations but there were people who got on without reservations and some people had to wait for the next shuttle. We found that the easiest way to go to the airport was to take the hotel shuttle to the Aquarium stop and take the Blue Line.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amylase
Reviews.Content: The suite was clean and big, and well-facilitated (even with a microwave oven in the room)! Hotel provides shuttle bus service to different local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm wet carpet, smelt funny, but very comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: meltay
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty average. Our room overlooked a carpark (who cares really as we were out anyway) but the carpet was damp, clearly clening up something ikky! The room also smelt really odd! But the beds were so comfortable, warm and lovely after much travelling. However would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycguestNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find good service these days, but the staff at the Doubletree was fabulous. I stayed there with my family, including two children, for four nights and was pleasantly surprised by their warmth and hospitality. The suite is perfect for families. And the cookies were delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay anywhere else. Great with young children”
Reviews.Author: ireland06
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. I stayed here last Oct 07 with a 22 month old and a 5 month old. The room facilities are great with small kids. I had a travel cot in main bedroom and travel cot in sitting room, so babies didnt wake each other up. There was still masses of room even with 2 travel cots and prams and everything that goes with it. I seriously cant recommend this hotel enough. We left this hotel as arranged on day 3 of trip to move onto the Sheraton in Framingham, what a disappointment as soon as we arrived we rang Doubletree and begged for a room for the rest of our 10 day stay, they accommodated us no problem. Did I already say I cant recommend this place enough!. Seriously dont bother with anywhere else. Ok so its a little outside of Boston Centre but they have a shuttle going regular to anywhere you could want to go. Stay here you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: houstonguy2010
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to Boston as I was donating a kidney to someone. We stayed at this property for 10 days. Check in was easy, the suite was nice and clean with a great view of the Charles River. Staff for the most part were great. Room service food was great, but they should bring dinner rolls with entree's in my opinion. The lounge was nice as well. Although we did not use it, they have a very nice indoor pool area. I did have a major problem during checkout regarding a credit card authorization. They charged my debit card as opposed to the card on the auth form. The front desk manager at the time was not very helpful with what was a hotel mistake. The front office manager did call back the next day and was very nice. This hotel is a great place to stay, clean and comfortable. I will stay here when in Boston next month.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this hotel and will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansLisa
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree on Soldiers Field Rd is the perfect place for families. The stylish king suite is spacious and very clean. It can be a little tricky finding the entrance to the hotel. The restaurant was a little pricey, but has excellent views of the Charles River. This location has all the amenities and employees were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but location can take some planning for transit”
Reviews.Author: ms9
Reviews.Content: Friday night stay, king bed non smoking, was on 16 of 16 floors with high sided balcony overlooking river and skyline (H-Honors member). Spacious standard chain room. Balcony was fun and helpful as Mars was very visible and got some great shots. Hotel has Jazz bar onsite and bar and food. Location is not the best but there is a free shuttle with scheduled pickups from Harvard station and drop off locations to Quincy Market, Copley, and 2 others. Cabs are very expensive and not recommended. I took the subway to Harvard and got picked up from there. Shuttle drivers seem flexible to drop off anywhere along the standard drop off route. This was the high point, the shuttle due to the northeast location. Get a free cookie for checking in :) Water pressure and noise were no issue. Hotel is recommended if the location is not offputting to you.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay but in a weird area of the city”
Reviews.Author: Gill87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before going to New York and despite the fact that it was quite expensive especially since that wasnt including breakfast,we found it very enjoyable. The rooms and bathrooms are spotless and nice. Nothing special but quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: phoenix1481
Reviews.Content: Stayed the 1st and 2nd of Oct. room was average at best. Torn fabric on chair one bar of soap for 3 days and two nights. Ordered room service and they brought part of the order had to call back and they brought most of the rest but still no dinner rolls and I got charged for soup that never arrived service in the restraunt was almost as bad. Had tickets for free breakfast and after being seated the first day never saw a waitress again and on the second day they didnt bring any coffee or juice until I was almost done. This hotel is out of the way for downtown and certainly not worth staying at if that is what you are looking to do. If you are going to sight see stay downtown. And I am a Hilton Diamond member so if I was getting preferred service I would hate to think what they give to regular guest.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmfc1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Suites for two nights as our son began college. The one bedroom suite was more than enough for three people. The HDTV in the "living room", which has the pull-out couch, is great. (The number of cable channels is very high for a hotel.) There's a second TV in the bedroom. There are telephones everywhere, including the bathroom. The special phone number for Honors guests is a gimmick as it rings to the same place as the help number for every guest. The shuttle to Cambridge was timely in both directions. The concierge is helpful with getting around town. The staff is reserved but polite, ending every conversation with "my pleasure." The buffet is outstanding. Make sure you get the cookies! Being 3 miles from Harvard Square, we found the Doubletree to be a strong alternative to the more pricey hotels in Cambridge and recommend it to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “NIce, but isolated”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights on business. Pros: Overall great accommodations, Good Service, big rooms, freshly renovated, maintained and yummy cookies! Cons: Poor air conditioning. No minibar. Tasteless generic in-room coffee. Horrible location. Taxi required to access practically anywhere. Details: First, the hotel should be called â€œCambridgeâ€� as it far from major Boston sites, business and areas of interest. Harvard and other parts of Cambridge are much closer -- but still a bit of a hike for the typical traveler. The nearest transit stop is 3/10th of a mile at the â€œCentralâ€� stop on redline. To access Backbay and Newberry Street it is a beautiful walk along the banks of the Charles River -- albeit 3 miles away. My room #302 was newly renovated and looked over both the Charles (exterior) and the hotel's 16-story atrium (interior). The room was orderly, contemporary, properly maintained and absolutely huge. I had enough seating for eight guests (too bad I was alone on business). The living room is nice, but I simply did not use. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom average. There is a mini-kitchen with refrigerator and microwave â€“ but no minibar. I agree that a major downside to the room is the climate control, which does NOT cool the room. I f the windows opened this would not be a problem. The result is a stuffy situation. In my room the air also made a loud rattle noise as it ran. Furthermore, beware of the third floor as some rooms sit directly above the hotelâ€™s award winning destination jazz club. The club is first class and popular with the locals. My room was exactly atop the club and I could hear the beat of percussion and live horns. Luckily management requires the club to shut down at 10 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Good Boston Business Hotel Without Location”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Doubltree Suites Boston for three nights on business. The hotel rooms are very comfortable and well maintained. They are clean and a great size, its very nice having the living room to stretch out in and the hi-def plasma TV is a nice touch. The bed is comfortable and the bathroom is a good size. There is a mini-kitchen with refrigerator and microwave in the room as well. Housekeeping does a good job keeping everything stocked and cleaned. The only downside to the room that I could find is the climate control doesnt get the room very cold which is a problem if you like a cold room to sleep in. The hotel's restaurant is pretty good which is important because there is nothing else around the hotel that you can walk to, you must drive to everything. The location isnt the greatest but the view is nice on the Charles River. The pool is ok, the heater was broken when I was there but if it worked the pool would be very nice and there is a spa in the room as well and a dry sauna. Other then the location the hotel was a pleasant place to stay. The only thing that would keep me from returning is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean”
Reviews.Author: CEHMaryland
Reviews.Content: We checked in for two nights in a suite at this Doubletree hotel. When we went up to the room, there were drink spills on counters, general grime on many things that had not been cleaned in a long time, and the room just was not clean. We returned to the counter and were shown another room. As soon as the bellboy and I entered, we saw a washcloth lying on the floor near the door. I went over to the sink and saw that the remains of food that had been poured into the sink. It went downhill from there. By the time we finished, the night manager was checking rooms with me and we went to six rooms. It turned out that the first room we were assigned was the cleanest of the six. He agreed that none of the rooms were suitable and said that if we kept the original room, he would send a cleaning crew up immediately and we could tell them what we wanted cleaned. We waited for an hour and a half and no cleaning crew arrived. I went back to the counter and he was surprised because he said he sent them right away. No cleaning crew ever arrived and we ended up cleaning the room ourselves enough to sleep in it. The night manager was very apologetic and said that he would satisfy us by making a significant adjustment on our bill. Our bill for two nights came to over $600 - he took off $20 for one night's parking! The restaurant was nice and the hotel has the potential to be nice, but the rooms badly need refurbishing and CLEANING! He said that some of the rooms had been refurbished and showed me one, but the only thing they really did was replace a few items and the walls were still dirty. The air conditioning was also bad in the rooms we saw. It doesn't keep things cool and is noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - HORRIBLE BUFFET BREAKFAST!!!”
Reviews.Author: fogeo1977
Reviews.Content: For the price of $189/night.....you cannot beat it. Each room is a suite with a separate living area and bedroom area and for that reason alone, I'd stay here again. The bathroom had mildew in the corner of the tub which was gross (Room #722). They should be more aware of that. Their complimentary chocolate chips cookies are too die for. The gym is lacking. No free weights, so bring your own if you care as much as I do. It's a very comfortable hotel overall and if you are with kids, on a budget, or just want to NOT stay in the center of Boston, I'd stay here. It's not far at all from any of the attractions, and you get gorgeous views of the Charles River from your bed! One STRONG warning - DO NOT HAVE THE BUFFET BREAKFAST. IT IS SO DISAPPOINTING AND MADE ME SICK!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annikits
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from the 13th to the 18th of August. Check in was nice and easy and the cookies we were handed sent my son into raptures of delight. We were pleasently suprised by the size of the rooms and out of the bedroom window we and a lovely view of the Charles River. My son loved the flat panel tv in the lounge. I was tired when we got to the hotel and pulled back the sheets so I could have a lie down. I noticed one of the sheets had a stain on so I called housekeeping. They immediatly sent someone up to change the bed. I then recieved a call from Kalika who was the housekeeping manager. He asked if everything was now ok and offered us a free movie for our inconvienience. He also got our 2 nights parking fee waived. A little later we had a small box of chocolates also delivered to our room with a note of appology. The front desk staff were wonderful with our son. Popping his popcorn as we didn't have a microwave. Warming his leftover burrito from lunch and giving him a good supply of the warm cookies. The concierge was also very helpful as was the bellboy. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again. Even though it isn't in the centre of Boston the shuttle bus was very handy and Cambridge Central T station was only a 10 minute walk away. If you don't fancy eating in the hotel restaurant the is a Wholefood market just over the river which sells ready prepared meals.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Trust the Hotel Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Justinian54
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with great rooms and a convenient location for our college visits. Our only problem was with the shuttle service which failed to pick us up as planned every time we used it. First night the van skipped our scheduled pickup forcing us to wait at the stop another hour. The second night they did not come at all requiring us to take a taxi back to the hotel, but only after several phone calls and another hour plus wait based on their assurances that they would be there in 15 minutes. However, the worst part was that we were blamed for the problems. On the first night the driver said he stopped and no one was there â€“ the eight of us at the stop before the scheduled pickup time would disagree. On the second night they told us we specified another stop that was different than where we dined and across town. Bottom line, if you are thinking of this hotel because of the shuttle donâ€™t - or just build in taxi fare. We will not got back to a hotel that does not solve their problems but rather lies about them.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it...”
Reviews.Author: jmpatrick63
Reviews.Content: Join HHonors before you visit...they'll treat you like family! It's nice to be greated by name when you call the desk. The room was clean. Not Hilton-clean...but clean. The suite was quite large. We loved the HiDef widescreen TV in the living room, and the kids loved the video games ($6.95 per hour). The view wasn't much, but no big deal...we were there to sightsee not stare out our hotel window. The free shuttle was fine, just make sure you plan your activites the day before because you need to reserve the shuttle for your destination. Staff very helpful, especially concierge. The warm cookies were yummy, and the kids both received a neat backpack full of activites at check-in. Room service was good, as was both on-site restaurants we sampled. A bit pricey for this middle-income family of four, but nothing unexpected. Sadly, there was no dining choices within walking distance of this hotel that we found. The river borders one side, a large industrial site the other. Walking anywhere was a bit intimidating. Parking was convienent other than not being able to access the 2nd floor of the garage directly from the elevators. You have to return to the lobby and either walk up the stairs or board a second elevator. No big deal, I guess. Very close (1 mile) to Cambridge, wish we could have spent more time there. Bottom line: the kids didn't want to leave but the hotel meal $$ was killin' me!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: brandy24
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on a Saturday afternoon. The front desk said there weren't any available rooms so we'd have to wait for one to be made up. I was fine with that because we were early. An hour or so later they checked us into a room on the 3rd floor. The room was fine--it was a suite, but both rooms were rather small and the living area is dark because the only window opens up into the hallway. I could live with the small size, but around 8 or 9 pm our walls started shaking. After a little investigatioh, I discovered the cause--the jazz club was directly below our room. Having two small kids, I was worried they would be woken up. So, I went to front desk and told them the problem. They said , yes the jazz club is right below and that is the problem. No apology. I asked them what they could do about it, because we weren't staying in that room. They got us another room on a higher floor, which solved the jazz club noise. Just our luck, our new neighbors was a family with ~8 people staying in the suite. They kept us up half the night. Can't blame the hotel too much for this, though I'm guessing 8 people is more than the room is supposed to hold. When I asked for another room the next day, they weren't particularly apologetic. Overall, I was disappointed with the attitude at the front desk. They were friendly, but not not particularly compassionate and didn't go out of their way to make our stay nicer than it could have been. The hotel is fine, but I would never stay here on a Saturday night unless I were sure that I had a room on a top floor. The atrium set up allows all the noise from the club to filter up to higher floors and the staff was not particularly helpful in finding us more appropriate accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: WetSactraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel specifically because it has a pullout couch in a separate living room. Much more comfortable for a teenage boy traveling with his mom! I was surprised at how comfortable and spacious the rooms were. The hotel staff was great and filling up on a big breakfast in the restaurant really helped. We only used the free shuttle to downtown twice. Walking to the Central station in Cambridge took us less than 10 minutes and gave me a chance to get one more cup of coffee from great local places along the way. Whole Foods and Trader Joe's are just a few blocks from the hotel. We filled the in-room fridge with sandwich supplies. We arrived late on the first night and walked over the bridge for a pizza at a local place on River Street. It was, hands down, the best meal we had in Boston. And the cheapest!

Reviews.Title: “Pluses outweigh minuses”
Reviews.Author: Hyph77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree over a long weekend. The hotel itself is nice and well layed out. It is very easy to access the Mass. Turnpike (I-90) which helps for arriving and travelling in the city. Unfortunately there isn't any public transportation within a 20 minute walk. The closest option is the red line from either Harvard or Central Square. Both are a hike. The hotel maintains a shuttle service that will take you into the city for site-seeing. I did not use it but other members of my party did and seemed quite satisfied. The room itself was very nice. It was a suite-style room with both a living room and a bedroom. The bathroom was in between and the bedroom had a door, which was nice when I had a coughing fit and could go out into the living room and close the door so as to not wake my wife up. The air conditioning was central rather than unit based which cut down on the noise and made it easier to adjust the temperature. It tended to get a little cold at night but was perfect during the day. There is a problem with the room doors. They are self-closing and seem to be weighted improperly. If you let them close on their own they slam shut. This was at first just slightly embarrassing but when the teenagers in the room next to me repeatadly allowed their door to slam shut beginning at about 5 in the morning it was supremely annoying. They seemed to be checking out so there wasn't really anything the staff could do about it. That was the only real problem though. Otherwise the staff were uniformely helpful and friendly. The price to park ($20 per day) is a little steep but is comparable to lots in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: skatwood
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 day stay at the Double Tree Guest Suites Boston. We were very impressed with the property and service.The kids especially loved the hot chocolate chip cookies at check-in. We stayed in a King Suite with a fridge and two TVs. The living area was nice. It had a table with four chairs and a big pullout sleep sofa. It also had a very comfy overstuffed chair and two lamps. My teenagers were impressed with the big LCD TV on the wall. You may request a microwave from the concierge and it was great to have. The beds were super comfy. We had a river view room and enjoyed watching the boats on the river. The shuttle from the hotel to various points around town was very dependable and saved us lots of taxi fares. We had room service several times and the food was excellent. The concierge was very helpful, and the service was great- even though it was full! We couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel. A happy traveler from Texas

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: GATraveler52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here weekend of April 12-15, 2007. We arrived around 2:00 p.m. and the hotel's restaurants were closed, but we used room service and the food and service were very good. It was a busy marathon weekend. The hotel was crowded, but the staff handled everything well. It is a large hotel, but there are four elevators, so waiting for one was never a problem Our room was cleaned in a timely manner every day. Without asking for a view, we were assigned a beautiful, spacious room overlooking the Charles River where we watched rowing teams from colleges all over the country competing. Our weekend activities centered around Boston University, so it was a great location for us. We were, however, unable to use the hotel shuttle because it leaves for specific destinations on a schedule that never coincided with our needs, and it does not take you to other miscellaneous destinations. We spent a lot of money on taxis since the weekend weather was rainy and cold. There is a Whole Foods and a drugstore within walking distance, but a taxi will be needed for other outings if you don't have your car. I would stay here again depending upon the purpose of my visit to Boston. It was a very enjoyable hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great room size but the location...”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravelpskk
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in this hotel. Room is nice and LCD TV in the living room is great. We have 2 kids and they loved the cookie and indoor pools. Location is OK with the shuttle but need more towards late nights. Sunday the shuttle close at 5 PM? Also, internet should be free and parking at $20 is too much.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Doubletree!”
Reviews.Author: Americanadian
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 with three teen girls. We stayed for 4 nights while we were tourists in Boston. We love this hotel. The service and amnenties were terrific. The suite was spacious and clean. My daughter loved the indoor atrium and we all appreciated the free shuttle back and forth into downtown Boston. My youngest loved the cookies at bedtime and the pool. We would definitely stay again. We also had a lovely view of the St. Charles River.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Rates, 'Expensive' Location”
Reviews.Author: BoSox0407
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that the Doubletree was an excellent hotel. Why would I give it a less-than-perfect rating you ask? One word: location. The hotel itself was quite nice. Very clean, accomodating/helpful staff, and welcomed accomodations. The price for the room wasn't as good of a deal as initially thought though. Booked the room in advance for $80/night, compared to a regular $120. However, the special rates apply to non-suites, which are smaller-than-average rooms that are typically near the elevators. Foot traffic wasn't extremely noticeable, but there were random occassions over the extended weekend where we were woken up by people coming back in for the night. Check-in was a breeze, and the staff was helpful. Didn't balk when we arrived a couple of hours before check-in time, and even offered us a room on a higher floor due to a performance at the jazz club that night. Check-out went just a smooth, and the hotel did not mind when we left the car in their garage for a few extra hours. Two other small quips are that the TV was a small set, and housekeeping comes EARLY (8:30am on Saturday morning), so make sure to put the knob hanger out the night before. Now, onto the 'location'. The hotel sits right off an exit from the Mass Pike, which makes it easy enough to get to. That's where the travel ease ends, though. The hotel is not close to any public transportation. The closest T stop is Harvard Square in Cambridge, which is a $7 dollar cab ride away. However, that requires you to travel through Cambridge on the T before you get back into Boston. The hotel does offer a free semi-hourly shuttle to here, and other destinations w/in Boston, but it was rarely on-time and it was hard to line up the schedules with our own. Its service also ends early in the evening (schedule says 9pm, but we found it to be closer to 8-8:30). You can request a shuttle at a specific time within the designated operation hours, but you need to give at least 2 hours advanced notice. In light of all of these issues, cabs become your best friend during the stay, but they get very expensive very quickly. You can get to just about anywhere west of Rt. 93 for $20 or less, but the frequency of needing a cab adds up. The cab drivers are well aware of the hotel's ill-fated location, so there will be a bevy of them sitting in wait in the hotel's circular drive. Parking is also a compound expense, charging $20/night in the garage. A little ridiculous, but actually comparable to most private garages in the city. In all, the hotel does what it can to make its location less of an issue, and otherwise it is a very nice hotel. However, if you are a person who is more budget-aware than most, you may want to keep looking as you consider the 'unstated' expenses of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Buchba
Reviews.Content: Came to Boston from Providence late at night. Hotel is located south of Boston so that was very convenient for us. Location far away from the city, but we didn't mind, because we had our car. What I looked for was clean and spacious room which this hotel offered. Bathroom was also nice and clean. They had internet access for a fee, which was nice. Also reading other reviews we didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but bought sandwiches at the Au bon pain, which is right in the hotel. That was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: notanotherone
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the best hotel I have ever stayed at. I had nothing but good experiences with the hotel, my room, and the staff. I was on the 9th floor with a great view of the river. Hands down, if I had a car with me, this would be my hotel of choice in Boston. Problem was, I had no car. I booked this hotel through Priceline, which I will hesitate to do in the future. This hotel is not in Cambridge, but in Allston, MA. It is a solid 15 minute walk from the nearest T stop (Central), or $7 cab ride. Its a $20 cab ride to downtown. This added up to a significant expense over my trip, and a lot of wasted travel time getting where I wanted to go. Yes, there is a shuttle and the drivers are super nice, but it doesn't run continuously or late. There is a Whole Foods market about 5 minutes away and it was nice to go there and get food, but you do have to cross that intersection that others have mentioned. When I was reading reviews on here before my trip, I was like "What's the big deal about crossing a busy intersection?" After seeing it, I feel like I could write a book about it! Its the busiest intersection I've ever seen, with multiple highways all converging in one spot. I would look out my window in awe at that intersection. Its not easy to cross either....seriously, I guess you have to see it to believe it. Anyway, none of that should reflect on the hotel. It was a completely positive hotel experience. I have no complaints, just be wary of Priceline if you don't have a car. I would have saved money if i had stayed in town and not spent so much on transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pickupapenguin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a seven week coast to coast trip in September. Picked because of good reviews on trip advisor. Hotel is nice. We had a room near the top facing the back with a balcony. Fantastic views of the Charles river. Ask if you can get a balcony room, it's worth it. Rooms are a good size and clean. Maid service was good. Scullers jazz club in the hotel lobby is excellent, we saw Deedles and it was one of the highlights of the trip. You can buy a dinner combination ticket for a meal in the restaurant first. This is a good idea as the restaurant is next door and it has good views of the river, although the food was only fair in my opinion. Downsides of the hotel were no airport shuttle or free breakfast, and the breakfast itself is not great. Also the hotel is a couple of miles along the river from town so you'll be getting a lot of cabs which can get expensive, recommend you get a car.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: kathieh724
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Check in was very accomodating, did get the cookies this time! We requested a late check out and that wasn't a problem. Not a bad location, views of the Charlse were very cool and rooms had a separate sitting room with pull-out couch. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room and convenient to downtown!”
Reviews.Author: PrinceRaider
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three days, September 9th - 11th and had a great stay. The most amazing thing about the hotel was the huge suite that we had. We have traveled all over the world but had never stayed in a place that felt like an apartment with a separate living room and bedroom - it was just excellent. During our stay, the hotel was full of Clemson University fans who were playing Boston College in football. The bar was completely full of fans after their game, but the staff handled each and every customer in a timely and courteous fashion. We also appreciated the friendliness of the staff. The shuttle mentioned frequently in these reviews was very helpful; we were dropped off on separate days at Faneuil Hall and in Havard Square and promptly picked up when reaquested. The one time that we did not take the shuttle back to the hotel, we rode the T Red Line getting off at the stop between Havard and MIT - Central I think. We then took a cab back to the hotel for a little over $5.00. I would strongly recommend staying at this hotel as the price was right and was really first class in every way with a concierge that was a big help with directions. (He furnished us with maps for Boston and how to get to Lexington/Concorde.) A great place in everyway and as a benefit, chocolate chip everyday in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Weekend 2006”
Reviews.Author: RJGutierrez
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on September 2nd for one night. Nice hotel, but very noisy. A lot of foot traffic, a wedding, and one of the reasons I chose the hotel - Scullers Jazz Club - was closed due to the wedding. The rooms are spacious with a separate area with pull out sofa and television, but the furniture and carpet are dated. There are areas of the hotel that need repainting and updating and just plain cleaning. The hotel location is very isolated - on a highway - but we had our car so this was not a problem. We had a very drunk bridesmaid on the elevator on our way back to our room, who screamed at us when we would not give her "jazz fingers". It was very embarssing for the boyfriend and a bit unsettling for us. It is not a hotel I would consider on my next trip - as the Radisson in Boston was cleaner, newer, more modern and with a more knowledgable concierge - all for the same price PLUS breakfast and parking. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Off The Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: PennFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our stay to Boston, August 15 - 17th. Booked on Priceline through a package -- Next time we know better -- Staying in town makes a huge difference ... Shuttle Service only goes until 9:00 p.m. and then you will be taking the taxi service home. If that is great with you, no problem. We attended the baseball game at FENWAY -- Great time... even if you don't go to the game, go for the experience. We loved everyone at the hotel, they made our stay enjoyable. Since it is off the beaten path, we paid $37.00 for two to eat breakfast...ouch! At Harvard Square you can find coffee houses, breakfast nooks, etc. Very good food if you don't mind the walk and crossing a very busy intersection. We didn't take the shuttle into harvard square. We stayed for three days and loved the hotel, the beds are GREAT -- you can really enjoy your nights sleep! Neutrogena hair and body products, coffee pot in room, and YUMMY cookies upon arrival. Overall we loved the hotel and hated the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: mdccy9900
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night and absolutely loved our stay. We were in town for our first Red Sox game and weren't very familiar with the city. The concierge was very very helpful and extremely knowledgable about the city. We arrived early at the hotel and unfortunately our room wasn't ready for an early check-in which we had been advised. The concierge helped us by taking our bags for us and keeping them there until we returned later that evening and were able to check in. That night, we checked in and were given warm chocolate chip cookies that are amazing! The staff was very friendly and welcoming. Our room was very very clean. The space was quite large for the two of us and the bed was extremely comfortable. We had a beautiful view overlooking the Charles River which was very beautiful to wake up to that next morning. The next day, we took the hotels shuttle to Copley center and then were able to pick it back up later that afternoon. The shuttle did break down in the middle of Boston, but the entire staff quickly sent another shuttle and handled the entire situation very well. We had no problems whatsoever getting to our destination. I would highly reccomend this hotel for a small family, a romantic evening out, or for a business traveler. The downside is that the hotel really isn't near any T-Station and a taxi is pretty much the only option. Other than that, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definately would return”
Reviews.Author: tippytripper
Reviews.Content: For a truly nice hotel you cannnot beat their price. BUT ... it is a little off the beaten track ... if you cringe at the thought of walking along sidewalks on high traffic roads and taking public transit or dishing out for cabs, or paying $20 per day for the honor of a parking space, this is not your hotel. Shuttle service worked fantastic for going to Harvard square where we took the subway, but we never were able to take the shuttle directly downtown. It was always booked or full. Hotel was very clean, staff extremely friendly and informative -- as was all of Boston in our Chicago-esqe perspective. It is in a very safe area. We know because we took public transit or walked. Pool area was hot, but if you wear your suit and get in, the pool temp was just fine. Hot tub was very large and fantastic for relaxing with family and friends and soaking those tired tootsies from sightseeing. We didn't try the restaurant as it was too pricey for us, but there were fantastic places to eat in Harvard square (again, you need to take the shuttle or a cab). To my knowledge, there is no restaurant, or convenience store less that 6-8 blocks away. Hotel was also fine with having food delivered and provided a stack of take out menus for us to use! Drinks were about $8 each from the bar (they were always ample size and most refreshing), bottled softdrinks and water were $1.50 each. Your room has a fridge and there are liquor stores in Harvard square and also a Whole Foods grocer about 6 blocks away. Housekeeping was top-notch and friendly. We made special requests to housekeeping on two nights and all were accomodated with smiles within a 1/2 hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 4 nights. Great facilities and service. Suite is large with nice living / dining area, large well equipped bathroom and large bed. Nice views over the rivier, free shuttle bus into Boston centre and breakfast service good (can't comment on dinner as never dined in the restuarant).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Good Cookie!”
Reviews.Author: klpopp
Reviews.Content: We had three families stay, each family included 2 adults & 2 kids and the place was nearly perfect. Price was good, rooms were excellent, front desk & concierge service impeccable. Only negatives: location made shuttle absolutely imperative, road noise for west and north facing rooms was surprising (even on 8th floor), morning heat on west side (best view) was intense & we had to call down everyday, save one, for enough towels & lack of ventilation fan in bathroom causes moisture buildup Remember to ask each evening for your cookie!

Reviews.Title: “Great beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Even though our stay at the Doubletree Suites was a quick one, I must tell you that the beds are awesome! We did not get to the hotel until late evening, but were greeted by very friendly and helpful front desk staff. Our short but sweet experience would make us inclined to stay there the next time we get a chance to go to Boston. What a great city! Just remember to leave your car at the hotel and take the shuttle into the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to families. The staff is very nice and very attentative. The rooms are big enough for a whole family with plenty of space for all the kid's toys. We'll stay there again when we travel to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great hotel, won't hesitate to give it the full 5 stars. Its on the outskirts of town, which saves you a ton of money over what you'd get for the same price in town! The room is really nice, carpet was clean, bed and furniture is very comfortable, and we were lucky enough to get a room with an excellent view of the river! the shuttle bus was convieniant. Its in a heavy congested area, but a nice area none-the-less. mind you, all of boston in general is really nice! even though it was raining, had a great time in boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: HelloNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, just a few minutes by car from Copley Square. Free shuttle to Copley Place, Aquarium and Boston Commons, but you need to reserve ahead of time. Newer hotel, well maintained. Good place for families. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great....But”
Reviews.Author: nbsandman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as a result of a Priceline search....and were aware that it was difficult to access and was not a place to stay if you wanted to walk or use public transportation...like the T. All that was true. However, the rooms are great...ours had a view of the Charles River and all the rowing crews...a nighclub featuring Jazz...and a good if somewhat overpriced restaurant.

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton - Boston
HotelInfo.Address: 400 Soldiers Field Rd, Allston, Boston, MA 02134-1893
